Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Entity:

Customers & Products

Job Family Group:

Marketing Group

Job Description:

bp is reimagining energy for people and our planet. We move our customers worldwide. We‚Äôre fundamentally transforming what we do so we can reach net zero by 2050 or sooner.

As a key strategic pillar of bp‚Äôs growth agenda, our mobility and convenience businesses are the shop window to our brand for consumers and businesses alike. The customer sits at the heart of our business‚Äô transition and as Marketing professionals, we want individuals who can play a meaningful role in shaping our offer and bringing it to life for our customers.

Marketing Data Analyst

We are looking for a customer and commercial focused Loyalty and Marketing professional that thrives and delivers in a 24/7 fast paced and continuously changing retail business.A Loyalty expert with deep knowledge and experience across all aspects of Loyalty program management and analytics, including campaign strategy, budget management, customer analytics and performance management within a retail environment.

Key Accountabilities

Leads and drives the data and customer insights generation within the loyalty team
Is the expert in accessing accurate data from various reporting tools (e.g PowerBi, Tableau, Comarch) to support the team with data-driven decision making
Leads projects with the goals to enable or facilitate new requirements for data interpretation and insight generation
Monitors and reports key performance indicators for ongoing campaigns
Creates deep-dive analysis on loyalty program performance (e.g creates quarterly performance reviews) on a regular basis
Manages, coordinates and prioritizes all requests for the Analytics Team and ensures timely delivery of data requests
Participates in campaign execution e.g. by coordinating the timely delivery of segmentation and targeting files
Participates in all loyalty initiatives and project executions and also, independently owns projects (e.g campaign set-up across all channels and connects with data providers)
Provides daily/BAU/demand support to the Loyalty Lead


Essential Experience And Job Requirements

Marketing degree or equivalent level qualification
3+ years in a Data Analyst role or data insights role or business consultant role
Generated and interpreted customer and consumer insights
Experienced at Performance Monitoring
Excellent analytic/quantitative mind-set
Must have fluent English (verbal & writing) as English is primary language globally in bp


Desirable criteria


Deep understanding of M&C Europe markets Austria and Netherlands
Demonstrated 3rd Party relationship and performance management
Ideally European experience in Retail environment
Demonstrated financial delivery capabilities (Budget planning, RCOP, Performance management)
Fluency in Dutch or German would be a benefit


Additional Information

This is a fixed-term position with a one-year contract duration


Travel Requirement

No travel is expected with this role

Relocation Assistance:

This role is not eligible for relocation

Remote Type:

This position is a hybrid of office/remote working

Skills:

Advocacy, Brand Management, Commercial Acumen, Customer Segmentation, Generating customer insights, Listening, Offer and product knowledge, Offer Development, Sector, market, customer and competitor understanding, Translating strategy into plans

Legal Disclaimer:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with an accessibility need may request an adjustment/accommodation related to bp‚Äôs recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an adjustment/accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us.

If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con experiencia en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de an√°lisis de datos.

El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y anal√≠tica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integraci√≥n y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.

FUNCIONES


Desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes √°reas de la empresa.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de m√∫ltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y est√©n listos para el an√°lisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards est√©n actualizados y reflejen los datos m√°s recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†

Key Responsibilities:

Must align with the Business Project to achieve goals and deadlines to optimize rentability and business growth.
Collaborate with the Product definition regarding data with the Product and BI teams and external providers, to ensure meeting business expectations.
Collaborate with the Product team to review the Technical proposals regarding data about the developments, and database structure.¬†¬†
Ensure data integrity and quality of data structure in the database to ensure the technical team implemented the standards and policies defined by the BI team.¬†¬†
Maintain the "Normalized data" dictionary for the Project database, documenting structure, definitions, and relationships of datasets, with validations from BI and Product teams, ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the process to achieve reliable data.¬†
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards for product and marketing metrics (including visualization)
Work in coordination with the BI team to create, optimize, and maintain data visualization dashboards, and reporting tools, define strategic alerts, and automate recurring reports.
Analyze and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports. Analyze the main KPIs and identify potential issues and/or areas for improvement.
Analyze and prepare reports regarding the impacts of implemented changes due to deployments, marketing changes, and AB tests.¬†
Analyze and report potential ad hoc incidents.
Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analysis, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, user behavior patterns, and more.¬†
Prepare a Quarterly Project Report along with the Product Manager and Project Director.¬†



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

Knowledge of data management tools and technologies, such as QlikSense/Power BI/Tableau,¬† relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.), and a strong understanding of data management principles.¬†
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to efficiently identify and resolve data quality issues in collaboration with the BI and Product team, with a can-do attitude.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with different levels of the organization and diverse stakeholders.
Must have a Product data-driven mindset.
Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines.
Advanced level in English (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget¬†
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities¬†
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean

Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Learn and familiarize oneself with automation tools such as EDI and Esker through guided training sessions and self-directed learning.

Support the implementation of new configurations of the tools through master data uploads, testing and documenting best practices with careful supervision from the order management team.

Collaborate with cross functional teams to translate new functionality or feedback on support requests.

Explore the adaptation of AI related to order management to improve process and gain efficiencies.

Data analysis of customers' order entry history and support requests, to build customers' digital profile and segmentation of different clusters

Provide custom-made solutions/paths to improve automation level and efficiency of his order-to-cash process in alignment with customer's sustainability goals.

Skills:

Enrolled in a Bachelors or Master degree program, Engineering, Information Systems or computer science

Strong interest in automation technologies and willingness to learn new tools and concepts.

Self-starter: ability to effectively prioritize, manage multiple tasks and complete assigned tasks with minimal direct supervision.

Effective communication and interpersonal skills, ability to collaborate with team members.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical users orally and in written format.

Keen attention to detail and accurate data entry.

Language required: Fluent English

Sharp, fast learner with a curiosity and aptitude for technical learning.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Tres Cantos, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Fresenius Medical Care is the world‚Äôs leading provider of products and services for individuals with renal diseases. As a global healthcare company, we have a special goal: to provide the best possible care. Join us to improve the quality of life for a growing number of patients around the world and be a vital part of our team.

Location: Remote (Spain-based, preferably Valencia). Full-Time Permanent Position

Required Years of Experience: 5 to 8

Senior Data Analyst:

As Senior Data Analyst you will lead the charge in transforming data into strategic insights. Harness your extensive experience, to craft sophisticated interactive dashboards using Streamlit, Tableau, or Power BI, tailored to stakeholder needs and industry best practices. Dive deep into data exploration, applying advanced statistical methods to extract nuanced insights and validate hypotheses. Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop robust mechanisms for ongoing monitoring. Your leadership shines as you mentor junior analysts and drive a culture of continuous improvement and learning within the team.

You will be part of a multidisciplinary and multicultural team, with more than 5 nationalities, which will enrich your experience and perspective.

Below you will find the type of work and tasks you will perform within the Data Solutions team.

Dashboard Design and Development:



Create and maintain interactive, user-friendly dashboards using Streamlit, Tableau, or Power BI tools.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into effective visualizations.



Data Visualization Best Practices:



Implement best practices for data visualization, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and accessibility for a diverse audience.
Stay updated on industry trends in data visualization and apply innovative techniques where appropriate.



Statistical Analysis:



Apply statistical methods to analyze data and extract meaningful insights.
Utilize statistical models to validate hypotheses and support decision-making processes.



Data Exploration and Insights:



Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, correlations, and outliers.
Provide actionable and strategic insights by analyzing complex datasets through compelling visualizations and narratives.



KPI Development and Monitoring:



Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and establish key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to data analysis goals.
Develop mechanisms for ongoing monitoring and reporting on KPI performance.



Data Cleaning and Preprocessing:



Clean and preprocess raw data to ensure accuracy and consistency in visualizations.
Collaborate with data engineers to establish efficient data pipelines for visualization purposes.



SQL for Data Access:



Write and optimize SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from databases.
Ensure efficient data retrieval for analysis and visualization purposes.



Collaboration with Data Integration Teams:



Work closely with data integration teams to ensure seamless data integration for visualization purposes.
Provide input on data requirements for integration processes.



Infrastructure and Azure Cloud Services:



Leverage Azure cloud services for data storage, processing, and analysis.
Collaborate with the infrastructure team to implement and optimize cloud-based solutions, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Provide input on infrastructure requirements for data storage, processing, and analysis.



User Training and Support:



Provide training sessions for end-users on accessing and interpreting visualizations.
Offer ongoing support to users, addressing questions and refining visualizations based on feedback.



Quality Assurance for Visualizations:



Conduct thorough testing of visualizations to ensure accuracy, completeness, and responsiveness.
Implement quality assurance processes for visual elements and data integrity.



Documentation and Knowledge Sharing of Visualization Processes:



Document the process of creating visualizations, including data sources, methodologies, and design choices.
Maintain an organized repository of visual assets for future reference.



Continuous Improvement, learning, and professional development:



Stay informed about advancements in data visualization tools and techniques.
Continuously seek opportunities to enhance and optimize existing visualizations for improved decision-making.
Stay updated on industry trends, new tools, and methodologies in data analysis.
Participate in training programs and encourage a culture of continuous learning within the data team.



Leadership and Mentorship:



Lead and mentor junior-middle data analysts, providing guidance on best practices and fostering a collaborative team environment.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant - Data Analyst
Description:
Miravia is looking for a Business Intelligence:




About Miravia:

Miravia is a cutting-edge e-commerce platform connecting buyers and sellers seamlessly. We pride ourselves on offering a diverse and dynamic shopping experience by bringing on board innovative brands across various categories. Located in Madrid, we work with teams from all over the world to build the e-commerce platforms of tomorrow.










Key responsibilities:







‚Ä¢ Collect, clean, and maintain user data from various sources including marketing platforms, mobile app, web analytics etc.

‚Ä¢ Be the expert in using data to measure and analyze business performance in each our markets and lines of business.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with product managers, marketing teams, and other stakeholders to identify areas of opportunity for improving user growth and engagement.

‚Ä¢ Lead new data analytics capability rollouts and/or data-led initiatives throughout Arise Project

‚Ä¢ Analyze user behavior data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can be used to improve user engagement, retention and acquisition.

‚Ä¢ Design market/business intelligence reports and performance measurement dashboards to share with senior management

‚Ä¢ Perform ad-hoc business analysis, to drill down on certain business challenges, providing conclusions and advice based on data analysis.

‚Ä¢ Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of user growth initiatives and make recommendations for optimization and improvement.




Qualifications:




At least 2-3 years in Data Analytics or Business Intelligence.

‚Ä¢ Experience in business, strategy and/or tech consulting would be an advantage.

‚Ä¢ Willingness to learn attitude with ability to understand new concepts easily.

‚Ä¢ Good at teamwork and communication skills with ability to work under pressure.

‚Ä¢ Solid analytical and statistical skills and at least 2 years working experience with SQL, Python is a plus

‚Ä¢ Experience in E-commerce is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Good communication skills

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with dealing with ambiguity of problem statements and having initiative to refine objectives along the way

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience in data extraction, cleaning, preparation, and dashboard development




Talent Attributes




We expect our talents to embrace values that enables delivering on our ambitious agenda. We will expect the candidate to be:




‚ñ™ Entrepreneur & Owner

‚Äì Takes initiative, proactively thinks ahead and holds self constantly accountable to drive the end result ‚Äì Prefers to try and fail rather than not to try at all

‚Äì Wants to achieve company‚Äôs success as if he/she was a founder and owner of the company

‚Äì Puts company‚Äôs success ahead of own success




‚ñ™ Customer & Seller Centric

‚Äì Puts customers and sellers first

‚Äì Is determined to deliver the best experience for customers and sellers

‚Äì Always looks proactively for areas to improve




‚ñ™ Innovative & High Standards

‚Äì Sets stretch goals for self and business.

‚Äì Is known for bringing new ideas to the table and always looks at ways to innovate processes or products

‚Äì Will always go for best achievable outcome while taking into account and motivating others ‚Äì Digs deep into content. Understands the relevant details, and how they impact the big picture

‚Äì Drives organization to make structural, impactful improvements




‚ñ™ Humble & Challenging

‚Äì Challenges ideas, while always showing respect for others

‚Äì Holds other people accountable, while setting the right example

‚Äì Agrees to disagree and then commits whole-heartedly to the decided approach ‚Äì Demonstrates open-minded thinking




‚ñ™ Communicative & Integrity

‚Äì Communicates clearly and listens effectively

‚Äì Works effectively by keeping their stakeholders informed of necessary information and initiatives

‚Äì Clearly practices honesty and respect to forge an environment built on trust

‚Äì Gives regular, actionable feedback




Please, send the CV in English




Why Miravia?

At Miravia, you'll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and encourages innovative thinking. We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive environment where you can grow your career. Our commitment to work-life balance is unwavering, and we provide the flexibility needed to ensure you're always at your best.




Application Process:

Ready to embark on this journey with us? Send your CV in English and tell us why you're the perfect fit. Whether you tick every box or bring a unique blend of skills, we want to hear from you. Diversity is our strength, and we encourage applications from those who bring distinct perspectives to our team.




Please, send us the CV in English!




Join Miravia, and let's shape the e-commerce landscape together!

Description:

Title: Mid-Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst ready to join our venture-backed B2B SaaS company and dig out all the hidden gems in our internal data. With around 100 employees, our team is mainly based in Malaga, Spain, but we are incorporated in the US and the EU (with our top-corp registered in Delaware). You can choose where you want to work from because the location doesn't matter, you do.




What is Plytix?




Plytix is the world's leading Product Information Management (PIM) platform for Small and Medium-Sized Businesses (SMBs). Plytix PIM helps companies store and organize product information ranging from descriptions and images to prices, and other specifications, in one place. Essentially, it's a handy tool that makes managing and updating product data a whole lot easier.







About our Culture




This is where you‚Äôd typically see a long paragraph of boring text that no one reads, peppered with corporate buzzwords that don‚Äôt mean anything. But Plytix is no typical company so we‚Äôll spare you that. Instead, watch this video, and if you like what you see, keep scrolling.







What‚Äôs the opportunity?




This is your chance to come and work for a high-growth B2B SaaS company based in the US, Denmark, and Spain. Plytix is backed by Tier 1 investors, such as Tiger, and is already a global industry leader within PIM‚Äîone of the fastest-growing verticals in the retail industry.




We're seeking a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you'll get an unique opportunity of collaborating with practically all departments, including Engineering, Finance, Product, Marketing, Customer Success and Sales. Your mandate will be to collect, consolidate and analyze data, to then present findings that drive decision-making and product improvements.







What will you be doing?




You will be our data wizard and the go-to person for everything related to KPI definition and reporting. You will be working very closely with different department managers and founders, to understand data needs and provide solutions and useful insights that will make a difference in the decision making process. Your main responsibilities will include but aren‚Äôt limited to:




Data Collection and Management

Design and implement processes for data collection, cleaning, and integration from various sources, using APIs and other methods where needed.
Manage, analyze, and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and reliability.




Data Analysis

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze and interpret data sets.
Develop KPIs and metrics to track business performance.




Business Intelligence reporting

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide meaningful insights to stakeholders.
Present data findings and recommendations to stakeholders effectively.




Product Analytics

Assist in identifying key product outcome metrics and their correlation to business outcomes.
Conduct behavioral analytics to track feature usage and identify improvement opportunities.
Help design and analyze product experiments to optimize product decisions.




Cross-functional Collaboration

Work closely with Product, Marketing, Customer, Sales, and Finance teams to understand their data needs
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations for product and process improvements
Support the improvement of data reliability in our backoffice systems







After 1 month:

You have been introduced to the entire organization and all processes in the departments you need to be collaborating with. You have been presented with the state of the art regarding data collection and reporting and you already have an understanding of what‚Äôs needed in order to get the best out of our data and to achieve stellar reporting.




After 3 months:

At this point, you have designed and established a convenient data warehouse where all the previously scattered data from different sources will finally live together. You have already implemented scripts to extract data from some tools and have started to create initial dashboards and reports for key stakeholders. You've begun to identify areas where data quality can be improved and have proposed solutions to address these issues.




6 months in:

By now, you have fully integrated data from all major sources into the data warehouse. You've developed comprehensive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to various departments. You've established strong relationships with team leaders across the organization and are actively contributing to data-driven decision-making processes. You've also started to implement more advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive modeling, to provide deeper insights into product usage and customer behavior. Your work has begun to directly impact strategic decisions and product improvements.




Who will you be working with?




You‚Äôll be the first Data Analyst to join the company, meaning you‚Äôll potentially become a key role in the organization, and as such you‚Äôll work closely with different department directors and the founders.




The ideal candidate will:




Have 3-5 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role for a SaaS company
Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts
Experience with data visualization tools
Experience with APIs and data collection methods
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Have proven learning background in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
Strong communication skills and ability to present complex data in an understandable way
Familiarity with product analytics and SaaS metrics
Be detail-oriented and organized
Speak and write native-level English







Nice to have:

Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and scripting
Familiarity with statistical analysis and experimental design
A dog‚Ä¶ We love dogs :)







To Apply:

Fill out the form and submit your video presentation or send them by email to hr@plytix.com.

Video presentation: for an explanation of the video requirement see this video üëâüèº https://bit.ly/3OF1c8u







Why work at Plytix?




Voted Spains #1 employer by Great Place to Work¬Æ
Be a part of a welcoming culture with bright, friendly people from around the world
Have a purpose and plenty of opportunities to grow from day one
Work from home or from our offices in the center of Malaga
Competitive full-time salary
Enjoy free catered lunches and unlimited ice cream when working from the office in Malaga
Private health insurance covered by Plytix
More perks (differs depending on which office you belong to)







PLYTIX is a company committed to diversity and equality. Therefore, all our selection processes guarantee equal opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, origin, nationality, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.







We are committed to managing your personal information with care and in accordance with our privacy policy. To learn more about how we handle your data, please click HERE

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics, or Programming


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

About the role

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets‚Äîyou aim to understand the "why" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities


Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.
Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.


Qualifications


Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.


Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:


Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team‚Äîseriously, we're awesome!


Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten

Title: Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

We are looking for an apprentice specialized in data analytics. Join a dynamic team in a complex Supply Chain and work for a leading perfumery company. We'll need you to leverage data in order to optimize supply chain, drive efficiency and enhance decision-making. We offer the chance to join a worldwide company promoting careers internally.

At dsm-firmenich people are at the heart of the company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Your Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data related to the supply chain, including data on suppliers, inventory, capacity, and Row materials.
Support regional IBP & operational processes, including inventory and supply chain management, Supply Planning, process management across AMET and EUR region.
Analyze data using statistical methods and software such as PBI, VBA, Python, or SQL to identify trends and patterns in the supply chain.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders, including senior management, developing dashboards to track progress over time.
Identify areas for improvement in the supply chain, such as reducing lead times, improving inventory management, and cost saving.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in supply chain management and data analysis.


We bring


A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected ‚Äì regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;


You bring


Master's degree in Statistics, Engineering, data scientist, or equivalent.
Critical thinking and proactive work style.
Analytical skills.
Pro-active, positive attitude, and willing to learn.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and other data analysis tools, to create and operate reports.
Knowledge is some code language software (SQL/ Python/VBA/M)
English is must, French/Spanish is a plus

Title: Data Analyst, Global Insights ‚Äì Internship
Description:
What You'll Do:

Criteo is in search of a passionate, highly motivated Intern to join our Insights & Marketing Analytics (IMAX) team in Barcelona. The IMAX team is a specialized, global team of insights and analytics professionals located in Barcelona. This global team is responsible for the insights that fuel Criteo-created content; the creation, execution, and analysis of customer, shopper, and marketer surveys; the analysis of Criteo‚Äôs own paid media; and the evangelization of data-driven methods and data storytelling across all of Criteo. While the IMAX team directly supports the needs of the global Marketing team, we also interface with commercially-facing teams (such as Sales and Account Strategy), with Criteo clients, and with the marketplace itself via conferences, via the press, and via industry influencers.

You will be working closely with the global Marketing team to create the insights that fuel our message in the marketplace. You will contribute to the analysis behind some of our most important pieces of recurring and ad-hoc thought leadership. You will see your work directly cited in the press, at industry conferences, and by our commercial teams. Examples of such work are available on our website.


Our Travel Reports at https://www.criteo.com/blog/global-travel-industry-trends-2024/
Our ROAS Trap Report at https://go.criteo.com/en/the-roas-trap/
Our Interactive Commerce Dashboard at: https://www.criteo.com/blog/commerce-trends-dashboard/
And many exclusive deliverables for internal teams, clients, analysts and reporters.



You‚Äôll work closely with the IMAX and Content teams to turn Criteo‚Äôs extraordinary commerce dataset into market-facing insights. You will also directly support Criteo‚Äôs in-house surveys of customers, shoppers, and marketers, on a global basis. You will create, launch, and maintain interactive tools using Tableau (or other technologies) that allow the broader set of global Criteos to access your work at scale.

The position combines traditional technical data analytics work, including the use of SQL, Python, Excel, Tableau, with the ‚Äúsofter‚Äù part of data science: storytelling with data.

This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyze data and solve problems. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about data storytelling and embrace the concept of the ‚Äúfull stack‚Äù data analytics professional as a career choice.

What you will be doing


Develop automations in Python to increase department efficiency and allow projects to scale
Develop a deep knowledge of how to analyze trends across client, product groups, and verticals in all of Criteo‚Äôs global markets
Understand how Criteo creates data across various data stores (Vertica / Hive / Presto). Become a point person regarding the meaning of data and best practices around data access.
Contribute to new ways of using Criteo‚Äôs vast storehouse of data, including developing higher quality approaches to existing offerings as well as innovating to create new market-worthy content ‚Äúfrom scratch.‚Äù
Liaise with other teams as needed, including non-IMAX Analytics, Product Marketing, Sales, and Account Strategy
Work with IMAX and Marketing team members to develop our strategic approach to content. Align our initiatives with Criteo‚Äôs overall direction and ensure that IMAX projects contribute to business results.
This role will also provide the opportunity to create custom tables in databases, to support IMAX data for the global Criteo analytics community, to own and maintain reports/code in Tableau, Python or other relevant technologies.



Who You Are:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Economics, etc.)
Strong interest in combining analytical/technical skills with softer/communication skills
Strong interest in AI solutions such as ChatGPT,Cursor, Perplexity.
Relevant work experience, with skills being more important than the specific industry
Strong communication skills in English
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Understanding of how to extract data from relational databases (i.e. SQL), including data which spans multiple tables
Interest in internet advertising and, more broadly, in Marketing as a discipline.
Knowledge of business intelligence tools: Excel / PivotTables / Tableau
Some experience with Python, in both the context of creating automation and using Python for data analysis and visualization



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

S&P Ventilation Group is a market leading supplier in the field of ventilation solutions. After more than 70 years, the S&P group of companies are serving to more than 90 countries all over the world through different subsidiaries and distributors. The Group is currently employing more than 5.000 people.

S&P Group‚Äôs purpose is to innovate by developing ventilation solutions that are energy efficient, easy to install, reliable and durable to ensure air quality in all the indoor spaces that we inhabit.




ABOUT THE JOB

As part of a recently created business analytics department, we are looking for a professional with good technical and analytical skills that will allow us to enhance our capabilities related to the data analysis through Power BI.

The Business analytics department works closely with the different business teams in all related with data analysis, increasing our data accessibility, improving our data visualization, and enabling teams to address the different aspects of the business with more information and obtain better quality insights.

Thus, this person will collaborate with the different business teams, both national and international subsidiaries, to understand the requirements and provide the analytical solutions needed. The role we are seeking to cover requires a proactive and curious profile. Part of the work will require to address new projects, without anything predefined, so it is important to have a wide perspective of the different topics.




WORK-RESPONSABILITIES

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop of KPIs, reports and visualizations through Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Connect to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel files, APIs) and transform data for analysis.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI Desktop and Service.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Provide training and support to users on Power BI tools and best practices.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.




REQUIRED SKILLS

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of at least 2 years or more working with Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent English language skills.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Poland or Spain)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech üëã


You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?


Docplanner at scale


We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.




Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


How would you be impacting our mission?


Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?


Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let‚Äôs talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Rosario Corti - Head of International Talent Acquisition
A 60-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (60 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


‚ÄúWe believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.‚Äù Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Rev-celerator Graduate Programme: Data Analyst
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

About The Rev-Celerator Graduate Programme üéì

Are you a recent graduate eager to shape the future of finance? Ready to make a meaningful impact and bring innovative ideas to life? Well, the Rev-celerator Graduate Software Engineer programme is designed just for you.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we‚Äôll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start developing your skills. After successful preparation, we‚Äôll launch you into on-the-job training where you‚Äôll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

The Rev-celerator Graduate Programme is now open to international candidates willing to relocate to one of our tech hubs in Poland, Portugal, and Spain. Get support on visa application (if needed), relocation costs, and the first month of accommodation.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who doesn‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ‚ú®

Unlock your potential, explore new horizons, and step into the future of finance.

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Participating in a specialist bootcamp, gaining visibility over multiple department projects across Revolut
Working to build analytical tools and machine learning models, such as dashboards and ETLs, for upcoming product launches
Helping increase visibility in sign-up processes and operational funnels
Maintaining and enhancing existing data infrastructure, including ETLs and LookML code, to ensure data accessibility and usability
Collaborating with stakeholders from Operations, Growth, and Product teams to refine features and uncover new insights
Supporting business needs with ad-hoc data analysis, including interest rate sensitivity, salary incentive profitability, and payments conversion rates
Learning from industry leaders and participating in weekly meetings to stay aligned with team priorities
Managing project tasks, tracking progress, and communicating key outcomes
Sharing updates about your work with our diverse global teams
Attending regular performance reviews to receive feedback and guide your development


What You'll Need


A 2:1 predicted or achieved grade (or above)
To have graduated university in 2023, 2024, or 2025
University studies in computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
Great skills with Python and SQL
Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
A proactive attitude
A love for problem-solving
Fluency in English
To be a quick learner
An ambitious and results-driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a dynamic environment


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
As an¬†SQL¬†Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining¬†SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of¬†SQL¬†Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

¬†

Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,

Solid Python knowledge.

Java is a plus but not essential

Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.

Experience in data modeling for analytics.

Familiarity with predictive models

Good understanding of Data Architecture.

Experience with Azure products.

Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.

Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

¬†

The key elements resource should have:

SQL¬†Development: Design, develop, and optimize¬†SQL¬†queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize¬†SQL¬†Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain¬†SQL¬†Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with¬†SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

¬†

Technical Skills:

SQL¬†Server: Proficiency in¬†SQL¬†Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

¬†

Certifications Needed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

HTML:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

 

Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,

Solid Python knowledge.

Java is a plus but not essential

Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.

Experience in data modeling for analytics.

Familiarity with predictive models

Good understanding of Data Architecture.

Experience with Azure products.

Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.

Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

 

The key elements resource should have:

  • SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
  • Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
  • Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
  • Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
  • Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
  • Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
  • Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

 

Technical Skills:

  • SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
  • Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
  • Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
  • Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

 

Certifications Needed:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.
