Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SOLTI is an academic research group that performs clinical trials of excellence in oncology. Currently, SOLTI is comprised of over 500 renowned research professionals distributed over a broad network of more than 100 leading hospitals in Spain, Portugal, France and Ireland.




SOLTI focuses its efforts on developing cutting-edge clinical trials with novel targeted therapeutics including innovative translational research, fostering the participation in international networks and promoting excellence in the management of cancer among their members.




Get to know us at: www.gruposolti.org




We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Science unit.




Main responsibilities:




Conducting automated statistical analyses for clinical and preclinical studies.
Designing and developing new tools and web applications for clinical research.
Developing prognostic and predictive models for biomarker validation in oncology.
Reviewing documents related to research projects, preparing statistical analysis plans (SAP), and statistical reports.
Supporting the design of electronic case report form (eCRF) in REDCap.
Using advanced biostatistical programming expertise to support sample size calculations, statistical power assessments, and the design and implementation of algorithms for health data analysis, including survival analysis.
Staying informed on the latest developments in cancer research and statistical methodologies.
Providing support for both internal and external communications related to scientific activities.




Requirements and skills:




Bachelor's or master's degree in Biostatistics, Statistics, Data Science, or relevant experience/master's in a related field.
Proven ability to plan, create, program, and manage complex statistical databases.
Skilled in the use of database management software.
Strong understanding of biostatistical methods, gained through education and practical experience.
Experience in clinical research within (bio)medical or academic settings, particularly at clinical and/or preclinical research centers; knowledge of molecular biology will be a plus.
Computer and analytical skills, proficiency in R programming, knowledge of SAS, Python, SQL. Other programming languages will also be considered as an asset.
Proficiency in spoken and written Spanish with a strong command of English.

¬†

Additional competencies:

¬†

Organizational skills
Motivation to learn
Autonomy
Results-oriented mindset
Teamwork abilities




¬†

This is a full-time position (38h/week) based in Barcelona (Spain).

¬†

What we offer:




Explore the opportunity of joining a dynamic and ambitious group with international projection in the breast cancer research.




We offer a balanced work-life environment, including the flexibility to work from home up to three days a week, a flexible work schedule, an appealing office location and additional benefits.




If you believe you possess the qualifications for this position, we want to hear from you!




SOLTI is an employer committed to Equal Opportunities regardless of sex, gender, sexual orientation, race, age, origin or disability.

¬†

¬†

¬†

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†

Key Responsibilities:

Must align with the Business Project to achieve goals and deadlines to optimize rentability and business growth.
Collaborate with the Product definition regarding data with the Product and BI teams and external providers, to ensure meeting business expectations.
Collaborate with the Product team to review the Technical proposals regarding data about the developments, and database structure.¬†¬†
Ensure data integrity and quality of data structure in the database to ensure the technical team implemented the standards and policies defined by the BI team.¬†¬†
Maintain the "Normalized data" dictionary for the Project database, documenting structure, definitions, and relationships of datasets, with validations from BI and Product teams, ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the process to achieve reliable data.¬†
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards for product and marketing metrics (including visualization)
Work in coordination with the BI team to create, optimize, and maintain data visualization dashboards, and reporting tools, define strategic alerts, and automate recurring reports.
Analyze and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports. Analyze the main KPIs and identify potential issues and/or areas for improvement.
Analyze and prepare reports regarding the impacts of implemented changes due to deployments, marketing changes, and AB tests.¬†
Analyze and report potential ad hoc incidents.
Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analysis, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, user behavior patterns, and more.¬†
Prepare a Quarterly Project Report along with the Product Manager and Project Director.¬†



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

Knowledge of data management tools and technologies, such as QlikSense/Power BI/Tableau,¬† relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.), and a strong understanding of data management principles.¬†
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to efficiently identify and resolve data quality issues in collaboration with the BI and Product team, with a can-do attitude.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with different levels of the organization and diverse stakeholders.
Must have a Product data-driven mindset.
Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines.
Advanced level in English (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget¬†
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities¬†
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean

Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

S&P Ventilation Group is a market leading supplier in the field of ventilation solutions. After more than 70 years, the S&P group of companies are serving to more than 90 countries all over the world through different subsidiaries and distributors. The Group is currently employing more than 5.000 people.

S&P Group‚Äôs purpose is to innovate by developing ventilation solutions that are energy efficient, easy to install, reliable and durable to ensure air quality in all the indoor spaces that we inhabit.




ABOUT THE JOB

As part of a recently created business analytics department, we are looking for a professional with good technical and analytical skills that will allow us to enhance our capabilities related to the data analysis through Power BI.

The Business analytics department works closely with the different business teams in all related with data analysis, increasing our data accessibility, improving our data visualization, and enabling teams to address the different aspects of the business with more information and obtain better quality insights.

Thus, this person will collaborate with the different business teams, both national and international subsidiaries, to understand the requirements and provide the analytical solutions needed. The role we are seeking to cover requires a proactive and curious profile. Part of the work will require to address new projects, without anything predefined, so it is important to have a wide perspective of the different topics.




WORK-RESPONSABILITIES

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop of KPIs, reports and visualizations through Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Connect to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel files, APIs) and transform data for analysis.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI Desktop and Service.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Provide training and support to users on Power BI tools and best practices.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.




REQUIRED SKILLS

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of at least 2 years or more working with Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent English language skills.

Title: Data Analyst en Seguimiento NPA's & Cost of Risk
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell







Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a m√°s de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posici√≥n privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.

¬°√önete a nosotros!







¬øQu√© estamos buscando?







Actualmente nos encontramos buscando un profesional con capacidad anal√≠tica y de negociaci√≥n, altamente detallista y pulcro, para incorporarse a nuestra unidad de Seguimiento NPA's, como Data Analyst.




Hablemos del proyecto...




Tu misi√≥n se centrar√° en analizar la evoluci√≥n del riesgo dudoso e impagados del Banco, de acuerdo a las directrices del Director de la Unidad, para alertar de posibles desv√≠os presupuestarios y ayudar en la toma de decisiones en la gesti√≥n recuperatoria.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrar√°n:




Analizar√°s las entradas en mora del banco para alertar de desviaciones presupuestarias.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
Purview is hiring SQL Data analyst with one of our valued clients. If you're interested, please reply for more details.

Job Details:




Role: SQL Data analyst

Location: Barcelona, Spain.

Duration: Permanent.




We are looking for 5+ years‚Äô experience.

Job Description:

As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,

Solid Python knowledge.

Java is a plus but not essential

Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.

Experience in data modeling for analytics.

Familiarity with predictive models

Good understanding of Data Architecture.

Experience with Azure products.

Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.

Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

The key elements resource should have:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.

Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.

Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.

Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.

Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.

Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.

Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.

Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.

Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

Technical Skills:

SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.

Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.

Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.

Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.

Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

Certifications Needed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

Technical Skills

  • SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,
  • Solid Python knowledge.
  • Java is a plus but not essential
  • Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.
  • Experience in data modeling for analytics.
  • Familiarity with predictive models
  • Good understanding of Data Architecture.
  • Experience with Azure products.
  • Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.
  • Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

The key elements resource should have:

  • SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
  • Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
  • Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
  • Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
  • Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
  • Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
  • Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

Technical Skills:

  • SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
  • Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
  • Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
  • Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

Certifications Needed:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.


If interested share your profile - kaustubh.chakraborty@ubique-systems.com

Title: Mid-Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst ready to join our venture-backed B2B SaaS company and dig out all the hidden gems in our internal data. With around 100 employees, our team is mainly based in Malaga, Spain, but we are incorporated in the US and the EU (with our top-corp registered in Delaware). You can choose where you want to work from because the location doesn't matter, you do.




What is Plytix?




Plytix is the world's leading Product Information Management (PIM) platform for Small and Medium-Sized Businesses (SMBs). Plytix PIM helps companies store and organize product information ranging from descriptions and images to prices, and other specifications, in one place. Essentially, it's a handy tool that makes managing and updating product data a whole lot easier.







About our Culture




This is where you‚Äôd typically see a long paragraph of boring text that no one reads, peppered with corporate buzzwords that don‚Äôt mean anything. But Plytix is no typical company so we‚Äôll spare you that. Instead, watch this video, and if you like what you see, keep scrolling.







What‚Äôs the opportunity?




This is your chance to come and work for a high-growth B2B SaaS company based in the US, Denmark, and Spain. Plytix is backed by Tier 1 investors, such as Tiger, and is already a global industry leader within PIM‚Äîone of the fastest-growing verticals in the retail industry.




We're seeking a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you'll get an unique opportunity of collaborating with practically all departments, including Engineering, Finance, Product, Marketing, Customer Success and Sales. Your mandate will be to collect, consolidate and analyze data, to then present findings that drive decision-making and product improvements.







What will you be doing?




You will be our data wizard and the go-to person for everything related to KPI definition and reporting. You will be working very closely with different department managers and founders, to understand data needs and provide solutions and useful insights that will make a difference in the decision making process. Your main responsibilities will include but aren‚Äôt limited to:




Data Collection and Management

Design and implement processes for data collection, cleaning, and integration from various sources, using APIs and other methods where needed.
Manage, analyze, and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and reliability.




Data Analysis

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze and interpret data sets.
Develop KPIs and metrics to track business performance.




Business Intelligence reporting

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide meaningful insights to stakeholders.
Present data findings and recommendations to stakeholders effectively.




Product Analytics

Assist in identifying key product outcome metrics and their correlation to business outcomes.
Conduct behavioral analytics to track feature usage and identify improvement opportunities.
Help design and analyze product experiments to optimize product decisions.




Cross-functional Collaboration

Work closely with Product, Marketing, Customer, Sales, and Finance teams to understand their data needs
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations for product and process improvements
Support the improvement of data reliability in our backoffice systems







After 1 month:

You have been introduced to the entire organization and all processes in the departments you need to be collaborating with. You have been presented with the state of the art regarding data collection and reporting and you already have an understanding of what‚Äôs needed in order to get the best out of our data and to achieve stellar reporting.




After 3 months:

At this point, you have designed and established a convenient data warehouse where all the previously scattered data from different sources will finally live together. You have already implemented scripts to extract data from some tools and have started to create initial dashboards and reports for key stakeholders. You've begun to identify areas where data quality can be improved and have proposed solutions to address these issues.




6 months in:

By now, you have fully integrated data from all major sources into the data warehouse. You've developed comprehensive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to various departments. You've established strong relationships with team leaders across the organization and are actively contributing to data-driven decision-making processes. You've also started to implement more advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive modeling, to provide deeper insights into product usage and customer behavior. Your work has begun to directly impact strategic decisions and product improvements.




Who will you be working with?




You‚Äôll be the first Data Analyst to join the company, meaning you‚Äôll potentially become a key role in the organization, and as such you‚Äôll work closely with different department directors and the founders.




The ideal candidate will:




Have 3-5 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role for a SaaS company
Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts
Experience with data visualization tools
Experience with APIs and data collection methods
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Have proven learning background in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
Strong communication skills and ability to present complex data in an understandable way
Familiarity with product analytics and SaaS metrics
Be detail-oriented and organized
Speak and write native-level English







Nice to have:

Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and scripting
Familiarity with statistical analysis and experimental design
A dog‚Ä¶ We love dogs :)







To Apply:

Fill out the form and submit your video presentation or send them by email to hr@plytix.com.

Video presentation: for an explanation of the video requirement see this video üëâüèº https://bit.ly/3OF1c8u







Why work at Plytix?




Voted Spains #1 employer by Great Place to Work¬Æ
Be a part of a welcoming culture with bright, friendly people from around the world
Have a purpose and plenty of opportunities to grow from day one
Work from home or from our offices in the center of Malaga
Competitive full-time salary
Enjoy free catered lunches and unlimited ice cream when working from the office in Malaga
Private health insurance covered by Plytix
More perks (differs depending on which office you belong to)







PLYTIX is a company committed to diversity and equality. Therefore, all our selection processes guarantee equal opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, origin, nationality, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.







We are committed to managing your personal information with care and in accordance with our privacy policy. To learn more about how we handle your data, please click HERE

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,
Solid Python knowledge.
Java is a plus but not essential
Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.
Experience in data modeling for analytics.
Familiarity with predictive models
Good understanding of Data Architecture.
Experience with Azure products.
Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.
Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

The key elements resource should have:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

Technical Skills:

SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

Certifications Needed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.





Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us

Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†

Key Responsibilities:

Must align with the Business Project to achieve goals and deadlines to optimize rentability and business growth.
Collaborate with the Product definition regarding data with the Product and BI teams and external providers, to ensure meeting business expectations.
Collaborate with the Product team to review the Technical proposals regarding data about the developments, and database structure.¬†¬†
Ensure data integrity and quality of data structure in the database to ensure the technical team implemented the standards and policies defined by the BI team.¬†¬†
Maintain the "Normalized data" dictionary for the Project database, documenting structure, definitions, and relationships of datasets, with validations from BI and Product teams, ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the process to achieve reliable data.¬†
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards for product and marketing metrics (including visualization)
Work in coordination with the BI team to create, optimize, and maintain data visualization dashboards, and reporting tools, define strategic alerts, and automate recurring reports.
Analyze and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports. Analyze the main KPIs and identify potential issues and/or areas for improvement.
Analyze and prepare reports regarding the impacts of implemented changes due to deployments, marketing changes, and AB tests.¬†
Analyze and report potential ad hoc incidents.
Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analysis, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, user behavior patterns, and more.¬†
Prepare a Quarterly Project Report along with the Product Manager and Project Director.¬†



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

Knowledge of data management tools and technologies, such as QlikSense/Power BI/Tableau,¬† relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.), and a strong understanding of data management principles.¬†
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to efficiently identify and resolve data quality issues in collaboration with the BI and Product team, with a can-do attitude.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with different levels of the organization and diverse stakeholders.
Must have a Product data-driven mindset.
Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines.
Advanced level in English (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. HTML:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values! 

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Must align with the Business Project to achieve goals and deadlines to optimize rentability and business growth.
  • Collaborate with the Product definition regarding data with the Product and BI teams and external providers, to ensure meeting business expectations.
  • Collaborate with the Product team to review the Technical proposals regarding data about the developments, and database structure.  
  • Ensure data integrity and quality of data structure in the database to ensure the technical team implemented the standards and policies defined by the BI team.  
  • Maintain the "Normalized data" dictionary for the Project database, documenting structure, definitions, and relationships of datasets, with validations from BI and Product teams, ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the process to achieve reliable data. 
  • Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards for product and marketing metrics (including visualization)
  • Work in coordination with the BI team to create, optimize, and maintain data visualization dashboards, and reporting tools, define strategic alerts, and automate recurring reports.
  • Analyze and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports. Analyze the main KPIs and identify potential issues and/or areas for improvement.
  • Analyze and prepare reports regarding the impacts of implemented changes due to deployments, marketing changes, and AB tests. 
  • Analyze and report potential ad hoc incidents.
  • Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analysis, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, user behavior patterns, and more. 
  • Prepare a Quarterly Project Report along with the Product Manager and Project Director. 


Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:

  • Knowledge of data management tools and technologies, such as QlikSense/Power BI/Tableau,  relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.), and a strong understanding of data management principles. 
  • Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to efficiently identify and resolve data quality issues in collaboration with the BI and Product team, with a can-do attitude.
  • High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with different levels of the organization and diverse stakeholders.
  • Must have a Product data-driven mindset.
  • Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines.
  • Advanced level in English (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environments.
  • Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.


Benefits

Perks of being one of us:

  • Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off 
  • Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer! 
  • Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
  • Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
  • Enhanced career path designed just for you
  • External training budget 
  • Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
  • Budget for team-building activities 
  • We celebrate all company landmarks
  • And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

S&P Ventilation Group is a market leading supplier in the field of ventilation solutions. After more than 70 years, the S&P group of companies are serving to more than 90 countries all over the world through different subsidiaries and distributors. The Group is currently employing more than 5.000 people.

S&P Group‚Äôs purpose is to innovate by developing ventilation solutions that are energy efficient, easy to install, reliable and durable to ensure air quality in all the indoor spaces that we inhabit.




ABOUT THE JOB

As part of a recently created business analytics department, we are looking for a professional with good technical and analytical skills that will allow us to enhance our capabilities related to the data analysis through Power BI.

The Business analytics department works closely with the different business teams in all related with data analysis, increasing our data accessibility, improving our data visualization, and enabling teams to address the different aspects of the business with more information and obtain better quality insights.

Thus, this person will collaborate with the different business teams, both national and international subsidiaries, to understand the requirements and provide the analytical solutions needed. The role we are seeking to cover requires a proactive and curious profile. Part of the work will require to address new projects, without anything predefined, so it is important to have a wide perspective of the different topics.




WORK-RESPONSABILITIES

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop of KPIs, reports and visualizations through Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Connect to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel files, APIs) and transform data for analysis.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI Desktop and Service.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Provide training and support to users on Power BI tools and best practices.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.




REQUIRED SKILLS

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of at least 2 years or more working with Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent English language skills.

S&P Group‚Äôs purpose is to innovate by developing ventilation solutions that are energy efficient, easy to install, reliable and durable to ensure air quality in all the indoor spaces that we inhabit.


ABOUT THE JOB

As part of a recently created business analytics department, we are looking for a professional with good technical and analytical skills that will allow us to enhance our capabilities related to the data analysis through Power BI.

Thus, this person will collaborate with the different business teams, both national and international subsidiaries, to understand the requirements and provide the analytical solutions needed. The role we are seeking to cover requires a proactive and curious profile. Part of the work will require to address new projects, without anything predefined, so it is important to have a wide perspective of the different topics.

¬∑             Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.

¬∑                Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

¬∑                Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

¬∑                Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

¬∑                Excellent English language skills.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
Purview is hiring SQL Data analyst with one of our valued clients. If you're interested, please reply for more details.

Job Details:




Role: SQL Data analyst

Location: Barcelona, Spain.

Duration: Permanent.




We are looking for 5+ years‚Äô experience.

Job Description:

As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,

Solid Python knowledge.

Java is a plus but not essential

Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.

Experience in data modeling for analytics.

Familiarity with predictive models

Good understanding of Data Architecture.

Experience with Azure products.

Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.

Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

The key elements resource should have:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.

Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.

Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.

Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.

Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.

Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.

Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.

Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.

Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

Technical Skills:

SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.

Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.

Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.

Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.

Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

Certifications Needed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.





Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us

Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We‚Äôve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.

Read more on‚ÄØour website‚ÄØabout how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.

Job Description

As part of a larger Data Team, your primary responsibility will be managing our Unit4 FP&A tool alongside two colleagues. Unit4 FP&A is a comprehensive software solution designed to streamline financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analytical processes, helping organizations achieve optimal financial performance at a reduced cost.

You will be responsible for collecting, transforming, and modeling data, building reports and dashboards, and ensuring all outputs align with our business goals and financial objectives.

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of business processes, system integration, and technical troubleshooting, while demonstrating strong collaboration and communication skills with multiple stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze, identify, and resolve data quality and integrity issues with strong attention to detail.
Translate business requirements into data-driven solutions to improve financial operations.
Create, maintain, and enhance reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Unit4 FP&A.
Develop and maintain well-organized data models for efficient analysis.
Integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow across systems and departments.
Provide technical support and training to end users while troubleshooting and resolving data or system issues.



Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Technology, Data Analytics).
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, including experience in complex database development, reporting, and automation.
Familiarity with CRM (preferably Dynamics CRM) and ERP systems. Expertise in Power BI or similar BI tools is a plus.
Strong communication skills in English, with excellent stakeholder management abilities.
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes.
Proficiency in cleaning, preprocessing, and organizing raw data.
Expertise in visualization tools like Power BI or similar.
Ability to create clear, insightful, and visually engaging reports, charts, and graphs.
Skilled in communicating complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficient in database systems with the ability to write complex queries.
Experience working with relational and cloud data platforms (e.g., MS SQL, Snowflake).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating across departments.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to clearly convey findings.
Capability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines efficiently.
Strong prioritization skills to focus on the most critical analyses.
Ability to keep up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and financial reporting tools.
Proactive in seeking opportunities for skill development and technical advancements.
Adhering to data privacy regulations and upholding ethical standards in all aspects of data handling.



Office: Lisbon, expected onsite presence 2-3 days a week.

Additional Information

Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We‚Äôre a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us.

At Unit4, we offer:


a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
a safe and inclusive working environment ‚Äì supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remote Lisbon
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI & Tableau)
Description:
This is a remote position.

As a Power Platform Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing solutions using Power BI, Power Apps and Tableau. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions that drive efficiency and insights.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
Design, build, and deploy Power Apps applications to streamline business processes.
Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements.
Integrate Power Platform solutions with other Microsoft services and third-party applications.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security within Power Platform solutions.
Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI and Power Apps.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Power Platform features and best practices.


Requirements

Qualifications:

Strong proficiency in DAX, Power Query, and data modeling.
Experience with Tableau.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits

Salary based on your skills and experience and according to the Software Development market practices.

Title: Data Driven | Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.

Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.


Qualifications


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

About the role

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets‚Äîyou aim to understand the "why" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities


Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.
Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.


Qualifications


Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.


Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:


Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team‚Äîseriously, we're awesome!


Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!
