Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our client, a global leader in marketing data and analytics, is seeking experienced Data Engineers to join their dynamic team. You'll join a specialised team responsible for building large datasets for global clients and work with cutting-edge technologies, playing a key role in shaping a platform that handles large datasets for global clients.

Your Role

As a Data Engineer, you‚Äôll be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure and pipelines required to process large amounts of data efficiently.

Key Responsibilities


Deliver tested, high-quality code while adhering to coding standards.
Build and maintain automation test suites within Azure DevOps.
Carry out manual testing, load testing and exploratory testing as required.
Work closely with BAS and other Senior Data Engineers to consistently achieve sprint goals.
Assist in estimating sprint-by-sprint stories and tasks.
Take a proactive approach to product delivery.


What You Bring


A university degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Business proficiency in English (minimum B2 level required).
Strong programming skills in Python, with hands-on experience in PySpark, Databricks, and Apache Spark.
Professional experience with a cloud services platform (Azure, AWS, or GCP), with a preference for Microsoft Azure.
Comfortable working with ETL data pipelines handling large, continuous data streams.
Experience with Agile methodologies, particularly SCRUM or KANBAN frameworks.


Valued Qualifications


Prior experience in a support-focused role is highly valued.
Familiarity or experience with AI and machine learning techniques is an advantage.


Why Apply?

Our client, a global leader in marketing data and analytics, values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. They're looking for innovative thinkers who are eager to make a real impact and contribute to their success.

Ready for the next step in your career? Please send your CV to ari.kilab@robertwalters.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Commercial Intelligence Team within the Revenue Management & Commercial Excellence department (RMCE) is looking for a motivated and driven Data Engineer who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

Who We Are

The Revenue Management & Commercial Excellence (RMCE) department combines commercial responsibilities with strategic pricing and the monitoring, analysis and interpretation of KPIs to optimize revenue. As an open and interconnected hub within the commercial organization, RMCE fosters transparency, collaboration, and synergy across all functions.

The Commercial Intelligence team owns the RMCE's department‚Äôs analytical products: from data pipelines, reports, and ad-hoc analyses to tools and applications. We support the department and the whole company in taking data-driven business decisions by translating big data into actionable insights and building automated solutions. Our long-term goal is to enhance our Revenue Management System with integrated solutions (reports, tools, UIs) that would replace our current product portfolio. To this end, our team is looking for someone with both data modeling and engineering knowledge to drive our offer to the next level.

Your Tasks ‚Äì Paint the world green

As a Data Engineer you will work on a wide range of interesting tasks to actively support the business teams in optimizing revenue, ensuring profitability, and fostering sustainable growth.

This is a highly visible role that requires rigor, self-organization, autonomy, hands-on mentality and entrepreneurial spirit, and will give you the opportunity to develop many transversal skills (engineering, data modeling, analytical, commercial, project and stakeholder management, amongst others).

You Will


Build automated data pipelines with the use of SQL, Python and workflow orchestration tools
Together with the team, you design, implement and optimize your teams services & products
Embrace modern DevOps and Backend Software engineering practices
Transform, test and document data
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, understand business requirements, and present findings to non-technical stakeholders


Our Tech Stack


Python
Snowflake
DBT
Jenkins and GitLab CI/CD
AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
Kafka
Power BI


Your Profile ‚Äì Ready to hop on board


At least 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or Software Engineer
Fluency in Python
Good SQL knowledge (in connection to Snowflake)
Experience working with workflow orchestration tools (Airflow)
Experience with DevOps and Infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab - CI/CD pipelines, Terraform)
Some experience with cloud providers, particularly AWS
You are familiar with Kafka
Preference for working along Agile frameworks
Experience collaborating with Data Teams
You possess understanding of analytics engineering tools such as DBT or similar
Knowledge of monitoring (DataDog) and data modeling (Power BI) tools is a plus
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


Our Perks ‚Äì More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule, and balance work between the office and home as it‚Äôs best for you. We give you trust-based hours and a flexible smart working policy.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We‚Äôre building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world ‚Äì and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: Data Driven | Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Engineer with experience in Python and ETL processes to deliver high quality data tools and support the business, with the following main responsibilities:

Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python.
Industrialize processes for full automation Assess client needs, understand the business and deliver a proper solution Build and design visualization tools (e.g dashboards).
Be the point of contact of the business for new suggestions and ways to enhance and improve the users BAU life (in data related topics).
Work closely with other Data Engineers to drive forward the DataHub and the data offer available to other teams within the bank.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in IT or equivalent.
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer.
Technically proficient with Python development language and Python libraries (e.g.: PySpark, Spark, Numpy, Pandas...).
Experience with visualization tools such as Microsoft Power Bi.
Proficient with SQL.
Good communication skills.
Proficient Level of English (spoken and written).


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Engineer with experience in Python and ETL processes to deliver high quality data tools and support the business, with the following main responsibilities:
  • Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python.
  • Industrialize processes for full automation Assess client needs, understand the business and deliver a proper solution Build and design visualization tools (e.g dashboards).
  • Be the point of contact of the business for new suggestions and ways to enhance and improve the users BAU life (in data related topics).
  • Work closely with other Data Engineers to drive forward the DataHub and the data offer available to other teams within the bank.


Qualifications
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in IT or equivalent.
  • At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer.
  • Technically proficient with Python development language and Python libraries (e.g.: PySpark, Spark, Numpy, Pandas...).
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Microsoft Power Bi.
  • Proficient with SQL.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Proficient Level of English (spoken and written).


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Master Data Analyst (Finish Goods)
Description:
ASR Group is the world‚Äôs largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal and Italy. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company‚Äôs brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino¬Æ, C&H¬Æ, Redpath¬Æ, Tate & Lyle¬Æ, Lyle‚Äôs¬Æ and Sidul¬Æ.

Overview

The MDM Finished Goods Material Analyst will be part of the Master Data Management (MDM) team, which resides in the IT organization within Data & Analytics. The MDM team is responsible for a global shared service for the management and governance of Vendor and Material Master Data objects within the SAP systems. The proper governance policies, standards, and quality of our master data objects are critical to successful global operations and support multiple business functional areas. This role is accountable for managing Finished Goods Material Master Data change requests with SAP-MDG.

Roles Responsibilities


Manage the Finished Goods Material Master Data objects in SAP
Classify Finished Goods Materials into classification groupings and assign characteristic attributes
Review Master Data change requests and coordinate with the business user community to ensure accuracy and completeness of the data, while avoiding duplication and misclassification
Participate in Data Governance Councils with our internal functional business partners
Continuous improvement initiatives to analyze and improve the quality of our Master Data
Work in a team environment during capital projects that use our Master Data objects
Execute mass maintenance programs that manage our Master Data objects in bulk
Perform test script verifications to ensure proper functionality of Master Data objects and MDG
Contribute to our company Metadata by adding digital content about our Master Data objects
Provide excellent customer service by communicating with people from internal functional business departments: accounts payable, finance, supply chain, procurement, engineering
Provide training to functional business end-users of the MDG process workflow and usability


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY


None


Work Experiences


Master Data Management, Data Process Workflow, Data Governance, Data Quality; req. 2yr
Engineering, Plant Maintenance, Buyer, Material Management (MRO spare part); req. 1yr
Software: SAP-ERP, SAP-MDG, SAP-DQM, Refinitiv World-Check One, D&B; rec. 2yr
Purchasing, Procure to Pay, or Accounts Payable knowledge that involves transacting with Vendors, recommended
Financial Accounting, Data Analysis, Reporting, and Business Processing Definition, recommended


Education Requirements


Associates, bachelors or vocational degrees in business, computers, data, analytics, engineering
Recommend formal certifications from SAP, or functional experience in ERP, MDM, DG, DQ, BI
Fluent in the English language; prefer multi-lingual in Spanish and/or Portuguese


Essential Capabilities


Strong analytical and research skills with meticulous attention to detail
Multi-tasking by processing a support backlog while working on project assignments
Excellent customer service skills with the ability to establish effective working relationships


For more than 100 years, our employees have taken pride in ‚ÄúMaking Life a Little Sweeter‚Äù by providing our customers and consumers with quality service and sugar products. Our commitment to that principle drives us in all that we do and encourages us to uphold our company‚Äôs high ethical standards of business conduct to ensure our continued success.

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.


In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work¬©.


In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.


Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.




Job Description



Analyzing, developing, implementation and customization of Power BI based solutions.


Competences:


Definition of Functional and Nonfunctional Requirements.
Continuously research and learning latest configuration and best practices of Power BI and then bring these configurations to live.
Assist in developing design specifications as well as providing demos (live, documentation and presentations) of the solution to the business.
Works directly with/in agile teams to implement the solution.


Qualifications


> 3 year of experience in Power BI and data modeling
Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop
Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence
Analytical thinking for translating data into informative reports and visuals
DAX experience
T-SQL experience
Azure DevOps mindset
Basic experience in agile IT, e.g. SAFE or SCRUM methodology
Experience in Power BI Premium workspaces (mandatory)

Preference in competences like:


Experience in using XMLA end points
Experience in RLS and partitioning
Experience in Azure on data related components
Experience communicating with clients
Ability to teach other developers how to develop processes for distributed environments

You should have analytical skills, willingness to learn and adopt new technologies.


Is mandatory to be business-fluent in English language (speaking and writing).

Title: Google Cloud Data Engineer | Banking Sector | Lisbon
Description:
Google Cloud Data Engineer

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for motivated developers with experience in‚ÄØGoogle Cloud Data Engineer to join our teams in Lisbon.

In This Role You Will Be Responsible For


Design, build and maintain data pipelines using Google Cloud tools (BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc, Pub/Sub, etc.).
Create and manage scalable, high-performance data storage solutions.
Ensuring data integrity and security at all stages of the process.
Collaborate with data science and analytics teams to optimise the use of data.
Automating data flows and creating ETL/ELT solutions for integrating different sources.
Monitoring and improving the efficiency and performance of pipelines.
Developing solutions for handling large volumes of data (big data).

Google Cloud experience in Data Enginnering
Bigquery
Cloud Workflows
Cloud Storage
Cloud Functions
Dataform
Data Catalog
DataPlex
IAM
Vertix AI
Looker Core
Experiencie in building DataProducts


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company‚Äôs hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback;
Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!


@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.


At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!


We are looking for an Amazing: BI Consultant


The amazing you, will have:

  • +3 of experience in Power BI;
  • Experience with databases (SQL, Mysql, etc.);
  • Experience in Business Intelligence and tabular models;
  • Valued knowledge of ETL tools;
  • Analytical spirit, innovative and oriented to the search for solutions;
  • Teamwork, strong communication skills and interpersonal relationships;
  • Ability to organize and rigor;
  • Fluency in Portuguese (spoken and written) and English


Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients of different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, soft skills and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Are you interested in a career in PepsiCo? Are you passionate about Digital Transformation?

Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: join us as the next Sales Data Analyst.

Working with inspiring and experienced colleagues, you'll find that the atmosphere in our office in Lisbon is informal and engaging. With an active, get-things-done culture, this is a place where your dynamism and agility will make a difference.

Your mission:

Are you ready to take your career further? In this role, it will be your mission to meet both our sales data and systems while integrating it with the most innovative tools. You will collaborate with multiple colleagues from across the world in order to improve, enhance, and develop the ways of working of our wide Sales team. As a key player, you will take charge of sales system governance, data integrity, reporting, process enhancement, go-to-market capabilities, and cross-functional collaboration, driving efficiency and innovation aligned with business priorities.

Responsibilities

Your day to day with us:


Harness the power of location intelligence to extract nuanced insights that contribute to strategic decision-making.
Employ advanced skills in data cleaning, preparation, and mining to meticulously ready data for analysis, whilst uncovering concealed patterns within datasets, providing valuable insights that drive informed decision-making and unlock new opportunities.
Utilize cutting-edge tools like Power BI to transform the data into visually compelling and impactful insights.
Pave the way for innovation by exploring novel data sources, including digital and underutilized outlets such as APIs, open data, etc.
Apply and advance knowledge of statistical tools, including Python, R, etc., for sophisticated analysis of extensive datasets.
Stay ahead of changes and upgrades to ensure a seamless integration and operation.
Collaborate and align with various stakeholders, ensuring the successful delivery of projects in line with business priorities.


Qualifications

What will you need to succeed?


+2 years of experience in a similar role.
Fluency in Portuguese and English. Spanish is desired.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to manipulate and interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in data visualization and analytical tools such as Power BI, Python, and MS Excel.
Experience with database management and proficiency in executing SQL queries.
Project management experience, including the ability to lead and execute cross-functional projects.


Don‚Äôt worry if your experience isn‚Äôt a perfect match - if you‚Äôre excited about the role, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

What makes us different?


Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Flexible work schedules & Work-life balance
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities


Being you at PepsiCo:

PepsiCo is an equal opportunity employer, committed to helping people lead healthier lives and supports workforce diversity. We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.

Planet + People:

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is how we‚Äôll transform the way we create value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people in the global food system.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
This is a remote position.

Key Responsibilities:


Report Building: Develop, design, and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using Tableau to support business needs.
Report Migration: Migrate existing reports from other platforms to Tableau, ensuring data integrity and consistency.
Consultative Role: Act as a consultant to various departments, understanding their data needs and providing insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business objectives.
Training: Provide training and support to team members on Tableau best practices and data visualization techniques.


Requirements


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on Tableau.
Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience with data migration projects is a plus.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science).


Benefits

Salary based on your skills and experience and according to the Software Development market practices.

Food ticket

Private Medical Insurance

B2B contracts may be accepted

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Are you driven by Technology? üî¥




If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge! We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation. Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions. From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business. With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.




Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. +3 years' in Data Analysis or Business Intelligence ‚úÖ

Experience in executing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes ‚úÖ
Proficient in SQL ‚úÖ

Design and develop impactful dashboards using Power BI for various stakeholders.‚úÖ

Title: Data Analyst (m/f)
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team. If you‚Äôre reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place.

What are we looking for? People who love technology and, above all, love to learn. And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority.

Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you? Just make sure you have the right skill, and guarantee the perfect project to scale your career.

If you‚Äôre a Data Analyst and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we‚Äôre actively looking for you.

What We‚Äôre Looking For


Experience with data visualization and reporting tools like PowerBI or Tableau
Strong analytical skills
Experience in SQL
Strong knowledge of Azure tools (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks)
Fluent in spoken and written English


What We Offer


Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams
Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you
Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings
We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us
Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit
Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success


Send your CV here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Data Analyst‚Äôs mission is to create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree in Information Technology / Mathematics / Statistics /Computer Science or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau, Power BI)
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ECI is the leading global provider of managed services, cybersecurity, and business transformation for mid-market financial services organizations across the globe. From its unmatched range of services, ECI provides stability, security and improved business performance, freeing clients from technology concerns and enabling them to focus on running their businesses. More than 1,000 customers worldwide with over $3 trillion of assets under management put their trust in ECI.

At ECI, we believe success is driven by passion and purpose. Our passion for technology is only surpassed by our commitment to empowering our employees around the world.

The Opportunity:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for overseeing the development and deployment of Power BI reports and their underlying datasets, to provide analytics to a wide range of functional teams at ECI. This person will lead projects to bring and enhance visibility into key enterprise metrics and drive action based on the resulting insights. The successful candidate should be skilled at asking probing questions for clarity and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical audiences. This role requires advanced proficiency working with complex SQL queries.

The ideal candidate is a motivated, detail-oriented individual who is equally comfortable with back-end data structures, visualization, and storytelling.

This is an Onsite role.

What you will do:


Reporting: Create PowerBI reports and dashboards that provide insights to stakeholders
Data Modeling: Design and develop data models that support business requirements
Data Vizualization: Create visualizations that help stakeholders understand complex data insights
Deployment: Oversee the QA and deployment of reporting made available for consumption; Coordinate and assist with User Acceptance Testing, conducting demos, participating in stakeholder reviews, as well as assuming the role of post-release Subject Matter Expert
Data Integrity: Communicate frequently when reports are under maintenance
Requirement Gathering: Responsible for working with other groups to efficiently define requirements and support their business objectives; these requirements will be used for tasks assigned to this role and tasks assigned to data analysts
User Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to analyze and isolate root cause of data issues and drive data cleansing efforts
Documentation: Maintain SharePoint knowledge base documentation related to solution requirements, data flow diagrams, business glossary and data lineage


Who you are:


Should have 4+ years of relevant experience.
Education/Experience: College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information science, management information systems, or business administration or a related field or equal years of experience
Data Analysis: Proven track record of analyzing large datasets and extracting meaningful insights from them
Statistics and Databases: Firm understanding of statistics and databases to be able work with data effectively
Problem Solving: Ability to identify problems and develop solutions that can help the org achieve its goals
Communication: Strong communication skills to be able to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and collaborate with other departments to achieve common goals
Change Management: experience creating reports in a sandbox before pushing to Production
Dedicated to innovation of existing operational processes
Ability to effectively prioritize and negotiate tradeoffs with stakeholders
Proficiency with ETL methodologies & syncing data across disparate systems
4+ years related experience and building analytic solutions
4+ years working with SQL and databases
Experience navigating large datasets
Exceptional at finding trends in data
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics to help differentiate between correlation and causation


Bonus points if you have:


Working Python experience, a plus


ECI‚Äôs culture is all about connection - connection with our clients, our technology and most importantly with each other. In addition to working with an amazing team around the world, ECI offers a competitive compensation package and so much more! If you believe you‚Äôd be a great fit and are ready for your best job ever, we‚Äôd like to hear from you!

Love Your Job, Share Your Technology Passion, Create Your Future Here!

Title: Rev-celerator Internship Programme: Data Analyst
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

About The Rev-celerator Internship Programme üéì

If you‚Äôre in your penultimate year of study, this one‚Äôs for you. You‚Äôll work with us for 3 months and get to know everything we do.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we‚Äôll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to develop your skills. After a successful preparation, we‚Äôll launch you into on-the-job training. At this stage, you‚Äôll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who doesn‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Participating in a specialist bootcamp, gaining visibility over multiple department projects across Revolut
Working to build analytical tools and machine learning models, such as dashboards and ETLs, for upcoming product launches
Helping increase visibility in sign-up processes and operational funnels
Maintaining and enhancing existing data infrastructure, including ETLs and LookML code, to ensure data accessibility and usability
Collaborating with stakeholders from Operations, Growth, and Product teams to refine products and uncover new insights
Supporting business needs with ad-hoc data analysis, including interest rate sensitivity, salary incentive profitability, and payments conversion rates
Learning from industry leaders and participating in weekly meetings to stay aligned with team priorities
Managing project tasks, tracking progress, and communicating key outcomes
Sharing updates about your work with our diverse global teams
Attending regular performance reviews to receive feedback and guide your development


What You'll Need


To currently be in penultimate year of a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field, such as engineering, computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
Great skills with Python and SQL
Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
A proactive attitude
A love for problem-solving
Fluency in English
To be a quick learner
An ambitious and results-driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a dynamic environment
To be able to travel to a Revolut office in your country of employment (hybrid working)
Full-time availability for the programme (summer 2025)


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.


Show more
HTML:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

About The Rev-celerator Internship Programme üéì

If you‚Äôre in your penultimate year of study, this one‚Äôs for you. You‚Äôll work with us for 3 months and get to know everything we do.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we‚Äôll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to develop your skills. After a successful preparation, we‚Äôll launch you into on-the-job training. At this stage, you‚Äôll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who doesn‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Participating in a specialist bootcamp, gaining visibility over multiple department projects across Revolut
  • Working to build analytical tools and machine learning models, such as dashboards and ETLs, for upcoming product launches
  • Helping increase visibility in sign-up processes and operational funnels
  • Maintaining and enhancing existing data infrastructure, including ETLs and LookML code, to ensure data accessibility and usability
  • Collaborating with stakeholders from Operations, Growth, and Product teams to refine products and uncover new insights
  • Supporting business needs with ad-hoc data analysis, including interest rate sensitivity, salary incentive profitability, and payments conversion rates
  • Learning from industry leaders and participating in weekly meetings to stay aligned with team priorities
  • Managing project tasks, tracking progress, and communicating key outcomes
  • Sharing updates about your work with our diverse global teams
  • Attending regular performance reviews to receive feedback and guide your development

What You'll Need

  • To currently be in penultimate year of a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field, such as engineering, computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
  • Great skills with Python and SQL
  • Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
  • A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
  • A proactive attitude
  • A love for problem-solving
  • Fluency in English
  • To be a quick learner
  • An ambitious and results-driven personality
  • Excellent communication and organisational skills
  • To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a dynamic environment
  • To be able to travel to a Revolut office in your country of employment (hybrid working)
  • Full-time availability for the programme (summer 2025)

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data analyst and Continuous Improvement - Trainee
Description:
Who We Are

As a global leader in generic medicines with a strong innovative portfolio, we are all in for better health.

Teva Pharmaceuticals has been developing and producing medicines for more than 120 years. Along with our established presence in generics, we have significant research and operations supporting our growing portfolio of innovative medicines and biopharmaceutical products.

Today, our portfolio of around 3,600 products is among the largest of any pharmaceutical company in the world. Nearly 200 million people in 60 countries benefit from one of Teva's quality medicines every day. We invest in research and development of innovative medicines, generic drugs and biosimilars, carrying on the legacy of more than a century of finding new ways to help patients improve their lives. This defines our values as a company and characterizes how we do business and approach medicine.

The opportunity

We are looking for a motivated candidate for the role of Data analyst and Continuous Improvement trainee

As a Data analyst and Continuous Improvement Trainee, you will support organizational transformation projects within Teva Portugal. Your responsibilities will include to propose, track and support change initiatives, including the review, documentation and optimization of internal processes. Additionally, you will cooperate in data analysis projects and initiatives to support needs of the business and to build on existing KPIs.

This position is suited for a junior professional / newly graduate with some knowledge of or interest in the Pharmaceutical Industry, along with good data analysis skills and a passion for process design and for driving organizational improvement every day.

Work languages: Portuguese & English.

How You‚Äôll Spend Your Day


Drive and collaborate with multiple projects pertaining to data management and analytics (i.e. KPI setup and tracking, database management, etc);
Support the assessment of current business processes;
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement, using data analytics & KPIs;
Track the execution of improvement initiatives in line with the broader vision for change and organizational goals;
When applicable, lead and implement improvement initiatives across the organization;
Monitor the effectiveness of the initiatives after implementation;


Your Experience And Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business/Economics/Management, Supply Chain, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, etc).
Proficiency in data analysis tools
Proficiency in English
Previous exposure to the Pharmaceutical Industry in Portugal and understanding of key business processes is a plus


Desired Traits


Curiosity and eagerness to learn and explore innovative solutions.
Analytical and evidence-based mindset, with a focus on data-driven organizational improvement.
Ability to communicate and work collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with limited oversight.


Reports To

Assoc Dir Supply Chain

Already Working @TEVA?

If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site

The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.

Teva‚Äôs Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment

Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to support you throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Please send us your application until the 30th of September.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Mission

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Inetum Team and be part of a work culture focused on innovation!

Location: Lisbon

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management;
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data sets to create visual representations that support decision making;
  • Work with the other departments within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards;
  • ...

Profile

  • Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar;
  • +3 years of experience in data analytics and dashboard development;
  • Professional experience with Tableau, Power BI and Dataiku;
  • Strong experience with PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
  • Experience with Azure Cloud;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Team work driven;
  • Fluent English;
  • French B1/B2;
  • Hybrid work - office in Lisbon (1/2x per week).

Send your CV & join our team!

Perfil

Organiza√ß√£o

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team's responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9

Your Main Activities Are


Execute data collection, data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises

Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Data Analysis / Engineering / Visualization
SQL
Python
Risk Management
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Active listening
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: RISK Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Themission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of theOperating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the riskand clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and InvestmentSolutions (IS) business units
RISKcontributes to the definition of the Group‚Äôs risk appetite, its riskdecision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to supportthe development of the Operating Divisions
RISKSystems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with acomprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market andcounterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support theneeds of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process
Inthis context, Operations team is a global team responsible for the productionof market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function. The team is splitbetween London, Paris, Hong Kong, New York, Singapore, Mumbai, Brussels,Montreal, Sao Paulo, Lisbon and Porto
Operationsteam is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systemsof the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the qualityaspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues areresolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) aboutdata quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, andassisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs arediscussed
Themission of Operations team is met by:
Ensuringclients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of theservices provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningfulKPIs about our main services.
Resolutionof incidents related to data quality.
Regularcalibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
Streamlining,running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialisation

Your Main Activities Are


Workon Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about thequality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality ofdaily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
Investigateissues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently.
Tohelp on the regular analysis and update of the parameters used in riskmanagement systems (such as interest rates or FX rates). Help to explainValue-at-Risk movements based on recent updates of such market variables
Providetraining and guidance to new users of the system where required
Buildclose links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Profile and Skills to Success


BachelorDegree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
Advancedlevel of English, both written and oral
Knowledgein
MSOffice Pack
PowerBI
Good marketand/or Counterparty Risk knowledge
Attentionto detail / rigor
Abilityto deliver / results driven
Organisationalskills

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Quality Analyst (12 months)
Description:
Job Type

Permanent

Build a brilliant future with Hiscox

About Us

HISCOX is an international insurer specialized in the market of luxury goods & property, and high end professional insurance. As experts in risk we give people and businesses the confidence to realise their ambitions. With offices in 9 European countries we have a very international staff and encourage a culture that fosters inclusion and collaboration, offering exciting opportunities for personal and professional growth.

In our Lisbon office we have the privilege of employing approximately 500 exceptional professionals representing 29 diverse nationalities. Despite our central location within the city, we recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. As part of our commitment to our employees‚Äô well-being, we provide a 35-hour workweek along with the option for a hybrid working schedule.

The Role

The Data Quality Analyst is a role in the Europe Data Team who is responsible to support the delivery of new Data Management practices within Hiscox Europe. Supported by Informatica platform, we aim to create the necessary processes, data quality rules, data lineage, data dictionaries, business

glossaries, reference data repository (amongst others) to ensure we have a robust analytics solution for the future.

These new Data Management practices are part of the wider strategic objectives of our European Data Strategy. As we build our new Data & Analytics solution, we want to be able to build the necessary governance around it.

Considering this strategic Data journey, we are going through in Europe, there is the opportunity to shape the path and deliver the outcome. There is also the need for you to contribute and work with the team in delivering our current commitments, so business as usual is part of this role.

What does a Data Quality Analyst do?

A Data Quality Analyst is a subject matter expert in Data Management, responsible for:


Data governance processes and policies delivering
Data quality assessment and monitoring using a Data Management tool
Business concepts consolidation and alignment
The ultimate objective is not only to ensure the robustness of Data & Analytics Platform, but also to expand the remit of these capabilities to our wider European application spectrum.
Main activities for this role should be:
Analyse Data Quality issues reported by Hiscox teams and act accordingly to fix them at the data source.
Monitor data quality improvements using reports / dashboards.
Identify and analyse BAU changes with impact on business mappings according to business requirements.
Maintain and implement changes on Data Management tool according to the : data quality rules, business glossary terms and metrics, workflows and data portfolio.
Monitor jobs execution on Data Management tool to ensure a correct update of catalogues based on the source systems, validate new scores of data quality processes and data profiling results.
Implement data governance processes and workflows that orchestrate the entry, validation and approval of data changes using data governance tools (Informatica) to ensure policy compliance and change awareness over the Business Units.
Ensure data compliance and data usage control in collaboration with Europe Privacy team.
Contribute to a unique view of business concepts for all regions/business teams, by identifying and reporting inconsistencies in their definition or calculation.
Support data consumers on self-service and concepts clarification.



Technical must-haves


Bachelor‚Äôs / Master‚Äôs degree, ideally in Management / Computer Science / Mathematic / Economics / Statistics (or similar)
Previous background in Data & Analytics roles (2 or more years), preferably in Data Management (e.g. Data Quality)
Knowledge of SQL or analytical/reporting tools required to perform data analysis
Ability to understand business needs and translate them to technical requirements
Fluent in English, verbally and written



Personality trades


Motivated self-starter who can work autonomously and add value in a team
Passionate with a can-do attitude, looking forward to find ways to improve the way we manage our data
Thirst for new ways of working to add value to the business
Ability to sell ideas and concepts providing background knowledge and information to the team as well as internal customers
Ability to link business needs to technical deliveries
Customer relationship management ‚Äì ability to build productive relationships with end users and deliver robust solutions to them
Business focused
Ability to work with ambiguity and change
Flexibility in both attitude and delivery style
Resilience



Nice to haves


Experience in Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics
Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence and Analytics tools
Previous experience with Data Management tools (Informatica preferable, SAS, Talend or any other relevant)
Knowledge of Power BI to understand the data models and validate KPIs calculations
Experience with Agile/Scrum based methodologies
Experience in the Financial Services sector



Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture

Title: SQL Developer
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: SQL Developer

Seniority: mid level

The amazing you, will have:


  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in computer science or software development;
  • Good knowledge of English;
  • Expertise in Unix development;
  • Hands-on experience in T-SQL development;
  • Some development skills in Java;
  • Development in Unix, T-SQL and some Java 1.8 components;
  • Technical analysis based on company requirements;
  • Communication with the support team to deal with escalations;
  • Monitor the entire project life cycle;



Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Who We Are

Gotbit has been in the market since 2017 and has established itself as a Tier-1 International Crypto Company. We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Our team of over 200 skilled professionals spans the globe, bringing diverse perspectives and expertise to our projects.

Currently, our Consulting Department is looking for a Lead Data Analyst.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and maintain data warehouses; ensure data integrity and consistency
Develop and manage ETL processes for accurate and efficient data integration; ensure smooth data flow for analytics
Analyze data for product performance and customer behavior; conduct A/B tests, develop strategies to improve key metrics and marketing ROI
Create and maintain interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau or Power BI; ensure they provide real-time insights
Lead a team of data analytics experts; collaborate with IT, marketing, and product teams; present findings and recommendations to stakeholders clearly and concisely


Requirements


Over 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other relevant programming languages
Experience with data warehousing solutions
Expertise in data visualization tools
Experience in product analytics tools
Understanding of ETL processes and tools
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex datasets
Fluent English (C1-C2)


Gotbit Offers


Remote work from any location
20 paid vacation days and 5 sick days annually
Full compensation for documented sick leave
Wellness support: We value our employees' well-being and cover expenses for sports, healthcare, coworking spaces, and team-building events
Continuous learning: Monthly Gotbit Educational Meetups featuring industry leaders help you stay ahead of the curve
Collaborative environment: Join our friendly and young team where all of your ideas will be heard


We look forward to receiving your application
