Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 2-3 years







The amazing you, will have:




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
At least 2-3 years of experience;
Proven experience with Python;
Proven experience with SQL mandatory and Azure;
Experience as Data Engineering with ETL, OpenSearch & Apache Spark;
Languages: Portuguese and English mandatory.
Onsite Porto




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!

Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Senior Data Governance Officer
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Governance Officer, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:

  • Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB;
  • Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)

You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Governance Officer, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:

  • Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies;
  • Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards;
  • Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities;
  • Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
  • Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.

2- Requirements and Coordination:

  • Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation;
  • Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements;
  • Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements;
  • Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.

3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):

  • Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical request;
  • Contribute to the strategic planning of DM roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.

4- Monitoring and Collaboration:

  • Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
  • Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
  • Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.

Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager Paris based, with regular interactions Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
  • Data Management and Governance;
  • BCBS 239;
  • Banking environment, regulations, and products;
  • Data Analyst, with expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau;
  • Data manipulation using DAX, M, Excel, SQL, and Python;
  • Synthesize complex datasets into clear visualizations and dashboards;
  • Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
  • English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
  • Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities;
  • Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
  • Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.

Only CV¬¥s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress




We are looking for a Data Engineer for a project based in Oporto (hybrid)!




Responsibilities:

Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python.
Industrialize processes for full automation.
Assess client needs, understand the business and deliver a proper solution.
Build and design visualization tools (e.g dashboards).
Be the point of contact of the business for new suggestions and ways to enhance and improve the user's BAU life (in data-related topics).
Comprehend business requirements and translate them into data requests
Work closely with other Data Engineers to drive forward the Data Hub and the data offer available to other teams within the bank.




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field;
Minimum 3 years of experience in similar roles.
Experience with Python and Pyspark
Experience with Power BI.
Experience with SQL.
Fluency in English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to lara.ribeiro@decskill.com with the reference "LR/DATA".




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Find your place at Amaris Consulting as a Data Engineer for one of our main partners, for a hybrid position based in Lisbon or Oporto.




In Amaris, we are currently increasing our team. Join our team and start a new adventure in an international and agile environment, where you will be able to fullfill your careers expectations in an fast-growing company with a dynamic environment.




üëâ WHAT WILL YOU DO? üëà

Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python.
Industrialize processes for full automation.
Assess client needs, understand the business and deliver a proper solution.
Build and design visualization tools (e.g. dashboards).
Be the point of contact of the business for new suggestions and ways to enhance and improve the users BAU life (in data related topics).
Work closely with other Data Engineers to drive forward the DataHub and the data offer available to other teams within the bank.




‚úçÔ∏è WHAT WE WANT ‚úçÔ∏è

At least 3 years of experience in a similar position.
Proven experience in Python.
Previous experience with PySpark.
Experience with PowerBI and SQL.
English fluent.




üöÄ WHY US? üöÄ

We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve our-self to the best. Working next to super talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of your colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, that‚Äôs why we can offer:

Benefits like transit, restaurant or kindergarten ticket, intensive workday, and private health insurance.
A great and challenging career path with the possibility to get certifications by our partners paid by the company, take the training of your choice with your annual personal budget, and once in a while you‚Äôll have a career path and salary evaluation so together can choose the best for you.
Upgrade your skills in our Tech Academy if your feel outdated or change your career path to learning new things. Participate in our language sessions, webinars, and workshops.
Feel part of our community by joining our team buildings, the afterworks, and the Event Of the Year!
And in case of extreme misfortune events, we have the WeCare program, where Amaris Consulting aid critically affected employees.




Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/open-positions/




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. ‚úçÔ∏è WHAT WE WANT ‚úçÔ∏è

  • At least 3 years of experience in a similar position.

  • Previous experience with PySpark.
  • Experience with PowerBI and SQL.
  • English fluent.


üöÄ WHY US? üöÄ

We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve our-self to the best. Working next to super talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of your colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, that‚Äôs why we can offer:

  • Benefits like transit, restaurant or kindergarten ticket, intensive workday, and private health insurance.
  • A great and challenging career path with the possibility to get certifications by our partners paid by the company, take the training of your choice with your annual personal budget, and once in a while you‚Äôll have a career path and salary evaluation so together can choose the best for you.
  • Upgrade your skills in our Tech Academy if your feel outdated or change your career path to learning new things. Participate in our language sessions, webinars, and workshops.
  • Feel part of our community by joining our team buildings, the afterworks, and the Event Of the Year!
  • And in case of extreme misfortune events, we have the WeCare program, where Amaris Consulting aid critically affected employees.


Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/open-positions/


Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Data Engineer!




Responsabilities:

Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python.
Industrialize processes for full automation.
Assess client needs, understand the business and deliver a proper solution.
Build and design visualization tools (e.g dashboards).
Be the point of contact of the business for new suggestions and ways to enhance and improve the users BAU life (in data related topics).
Work closely with other Data Engineers to drive forward the DataHub and the data offer available to other teams within the bank.




Requirements:

Experience in Python.
Experience in PySpark.
Experience in PowerBI.
Experience in SQL.
Good comunication skills.
Proficiency in English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/DataEngineer‚Äù




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers. With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


What is your mission:

We are looking for a Data Engineer to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector.


The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry. You will join an international and diverse team.


Main Tasks:

  • Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python;
  • Industrialize processes for full automation;
  • Assess client needs, understand the business and deliver a proper solution;
  • Build and design visualization tools (e.g dashboards);
  • Be the point of contact of the business for new suggestions and ways to enhance and improve the users BAU life (in data related topics);
  • Work closely with other Data Engineers to drive forward the DataHub and the data offer available to other teams.


The talent we are looking for:

  • Previous experience working with Python and PySpark;
  • Experience with Microsoft Power BI;
  • Experience with SQL;
  • Comfortable with the english language (mandatory).



Why Neotalent:

  • More than 20 years of experience in technology and business development;
  • Access to ongoing technical training and solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies;
  • Opportunity to be seen and recognized, to work on the best projects and to make choices that guarantee an exciting career;
  • Opportunity to work on international projects and be part of an Everyshore for EveryChallenge paradigm.

Title: KYC Officer
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

Know Your Client (KYC) are standards used in the investment, financial and insurance services industry to verify customers and know their risk and financial profiles.

KYC Analyst primary focus is to gather client data and documentation to build a KYC file to support the due diligence assessment of prospective and existing clients.

KYC analyst will be responsible for the onboarding and periodic review of clients in a timely manner, in line with business strategy and needs, and for ensuring consistent application of local and global KYC policies through the lifecycle of clients.

Main tasks and goals:

  • Conducts initial checks against internal data/database to determine KYC information held internally;
  • Analyze and determine account documentation required based upon counterparty type and products traded as well as approving adequacy of account documentation and financial information received from prospective customers and performs Gap Analysis with existing documents;
  • Liaises internally with relevant stakeholders for list of required KYC and Regulatory documents, determines required documents for KYC;
  • Perform detailed Sanctions Screening and PEP reviews;
  • Organize documents collected and extracts relevant data to support the KYC process. Also, ensures and validate that collected documents are consistent, valid, and adequate with internal procedures/guidelines, while ensuring due diligences regarding local requirements are properly performed;
  • Enter or update systems with data related to scoring grid, based on the documentary analysis performed;
  • Escalates risks and issues when necessary to other internal actors to deal with higher risk elements/situations;
  • Document upload and data capture;
  • Interact with the Compliance department to follow internal policies and procedures as well as adapting to changes in procedure or regulatory requirements as communicated;
  • Ensure the production, analysis, and communication of the management indicators - when entering a relationship with new prospects/customers or third parties;
  • Support the implementation of new processes by ensuring their proper application;
  • Assist the department manager in various tasks related to, but not limited to, working with, and rolling out to the group the implementation of new controls and efficiencies where needed.

Additional information:

  • Ability to manage stress and work in a constantly evolving regulatory landscape;
  • Strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills;
  • Experience to work with global stakeholders namely APAC, AMER, EMEA (one or more).

Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Management/Economics/Finance/Legal or related ae;
  • KYC/Vetting related functions (1-2 years);
  • U.S. AML/KYC rules and best practices (notions);
  • Microsoft office (Excel Power Pivot);
  • Fluency in English and French level is a plus.

Soft Skills:

  • Stress and work management;
  • Analytical and communication skills;
  • Work ethic;
  • Interpersonal communication and emotional intelligence;
  • Autonomy.

We will only consider English CV's

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: mid level

Type of position: hybrid

The amazing you, will have:




3+years experience working with data;
Proficiency in SQL (Crud, data models, transactionality, tuning);
Knowledge about multidimensional modeling concepts;
Strong data analysis skills;
TDD\BDD knowledge;
Knowledge of Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration, Delivery, and Deployment through CI Pipelines;
Good English level.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Good French level




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!

Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us




We love data.

Envisioning advanced data architectures and bringing them to live is our passion.

reeeliance is a consultancy specializing in Data Management, Fast Data, Advanced Analytics, and DataOps. We further support our clients in modernizing their SAP landscape and moving their business to the cloud.




Based in Hamburg, Berlin, and Porto, we combine strategic foresight with sound data and software engineering craftsmanship to define, build, and operate scalable information ecosystems for our international clients, helping them transform into real data-driven enterprises.




About the role




Data is undeniably one of the world's most valuable resources. However, it's futile if it's not in the right place or the right setup. We strive to place data where it's needed most and can be used to its fullest potential.




Become a valued member of our data integration team and build with us highly scalable data architectures and fast data pipelines for our multinational clients. Our use cases range from data warehouse and lakehouse architectures implementations over IoT and data streaming setups to sophisticated AI scenarios, in industries ranging from manufacturing, consumer products, healthcare to banking and insurance, just to name a few.




Our Tech Stack at a glance

Coding: SQL, Python | Data Pipeline: Matillion, VaultSpeed | Data Storage: Snowflake, Azure Synapse | DevOps: Azure DevOps, GitLab




Your responsibilities:




In this role you have the chance to design, build and maintain data pipelines according to the client's business needs and embed them end-to-end into the given data stack
As a Data Engineer you will maintain and optimize the data infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources
You build, maintain, and deploy data artifacts on cloud platforms
You will ensure of data accuracy, integrity, privacy, security, and compliance by applying data quality assurances methods
Your responsibility will include monitoring of data pipeline performance as well as the implementation of optimization strategies
You will work together with both reeeliance and client staff as part of an agile team




Our requirements:




Proficiency in both classic and recent data modeling concepts
Applicable knowledge in data warehousing architectures and best practice design
Experience and confidence in using at least one ETL tool and proficiency in Python
Ability to read and understand complex data flows paired with strong SQL skills
Hands on experience in orchestrating data pipelines within cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
Problem-solving attitude
Independent working style
Experience with working as part of a team in agile project setups
A university degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline
Articulate with impeccable verbal and written communication skills in English. Strong & discerning listener. Another language skill is a plus




What we offer:




Responsible roles in international projects
Space to grow and to take over responsibility
Dedicated onboarding program
Work with the cutting-edge technology
A permanent employment in a family-friendly company,
Working in a multinational team (more than 15 nationalities)
Flexible working hours
Participation in regular team events in Berlin and Hamburg
Further training opportunities
Modern equipment
Classes of German language
And many other Job perks (childcare subsidy, company pension scheme, job bike, etc‚Ä¶)




We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team.




JOIN US ‚Äì and grab your opportunity!




Please have in mind only short-listed candidates will be contacted.




For any questions, please write to marija.sekularac@reeeliance.com or send a DM.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work¬©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.


Job Description


  • Providing first level support for Loan IQ users on an IT point of view;

Qualifications

  • Have previous experience working as an IT Business Analyst (on the IT side), minimum 4 years
  • Agile framework experience needed;
  • SQL knowledge needed;
  • Have a good level of English ‚Äì B2 minimum;
  • Be proactive and capable to work in autonomy;
  • Loan IQ knowledge (nice to have)

Title: Accounting Data Analyst ‚Äì M/F ‚Äì Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for an Accounting Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC FAR DATA TEAM

‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (stands for Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk. You responsibilities will be to collect, check, and provide data from our business to our internal clients (Finance, Actuary ‚Ä¶) using automated tools.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE FAR DATA TEAM


Participate in data quality audit work on a defined scope:
Participate in the administration of the necessary repositories on its perimeter
Participate in the development of the reference documentation associated with the data
Participate in the governance of data quality


As Our New Accounting Data Analyst, You Must Have


Degree in Data Analysis, Finance or Actuarial
Professional background about 3/5 years in data analysis for finance/accounting functions.
Fluent in English (C1 level is mandatory)
Fluency in French (B1-B2 level would be greatly appreciated, but not mandatory)
Strong Excel VBA skills
Professional experience with SAS
Experience or academic knowledge of the actuarial sector would be a big plus


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Senior Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Our Client is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.

What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds

What is my role like?

We are looking for an experienced Senior Functional Data Analyst to help consolidate and expand the Business Intelligence (BI) area within our IT department. This professional will be responsible for supporting leadership in defining standards and best practices for data visualization, using Power BI as the primary tool. Additionally, they will play a key role in communication and negotiation with managers, ensuring that BI solutions are effective and aligned with the company's strategic needs.

What will my daily tasks involve?


Assist in creating and implementing standards for the use of Power BI across the organization, ensuring consistency and quality in data visualizations.
Collaborate with IT leadership to develop and execute Business Intelligence strategies that support business objectives.
Work directly with managers to understand data needs and ensure that dashboards and reports are effective for decision-making. Facilitate communication between technical and business teams, ensuring that requirements are clear and feasible.
Create and optimize dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring that visualizations are intuitive, actionable, and aligned with business needs.
Monitor the use of BI solutions and implement improvements based on continuous feedback, aiming to enhance the effectiveness of data visualization tools.


What is expected from me?


Experience as a Product Manager, Functional Data Analyst or in related roles, with a strong focus on Business Intelligence and Power BI.
Excellent negotiation and communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders at different levels and areas.
Proficiency in English, essential for collaboration with international teams and potential expansions in Malta.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, IT Management, or related fields. A Master's degree is a plus.


What can I expect from company?


A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access, complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (Cloud Technologies)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
At Sogrape, we are embarking on a transformative data journey, and we are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. Be part of our data transformation journey as the Cloud Data Platform Lead Analyst. You will oversee the implementation of a cloud-based data platform analytic solutions, from design to deployment. Your role will involve architecting scalable solutions, integrating diverse datasets, and execute reporting for the organisation.




In this role, as Lead data analyst, you will engage with business stakeholders to discuss their requirements, implement challenging analytic solutions, and ensure comprehensive reporting across the organization. You will be responsible for upholding data governance and quality, shaping our organization's data infrastructure to drive valuable insights.




If you are skilled in cloud technologies and passionate about data-driven solutions, join us in this impactful project. Apply now and become a catalyst in our organization's data transformation journey.




Your main responsibilities:

Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions
You will be responsible for developing comprehensive analytic solutions tailored to business requirements and ensuring that organizational reporting meets the highest standards of accuracy and relevance
Ensure data quality and governance by implementing and maintaining data standards, policies, and procedures
Collect, clean and analyze data from various sources, including Google Cloud Platform or others, to provide actionable insights
Build and maintain reports and dashboards in Power BI to support business decision-making
Provide training and support to business users, empowering them to effectively interact with data visualizations and accurately interpret results
Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and data reporting practices, continuously improving our business intelligence platform




What we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field
Minimum of 2 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a focus on building reporting and analysis for business
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, such as Azure (Data Factory, Power BI, SQL) and Google Cloud (BigQuery)
Possess strong analytical skills and a solid understanding of data modelling, particularly within cloud data architectures. Ensure adherence to data quality and governance principles for implementing analytic solutions tailored to business needs
Proficient in structured query languages (SQL) and programming languages such as Python, PySpark
Strong communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work closely with business stakeholders to translate their requirements into data and reporting needs
Experience in providing training and support to business users on data visualizations and interpretation
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment




What we have to offer:

Work with a specialized team in a global family wine company with a strong international presence in more than 120 markets
Hybrid working model and additional vacation days
Exclusive access to our top-quality wines and great brands
Exclusive access to wine tourism experiences at our properties
Specialized wine training at the Sogrape Wine Academy
Health Insurance, Sogrape Pension Plan, Flexible Benefits Plan, and wellness initiatives
Professional development opportunities




Apply now to be part of our exciting journey!

Show more

‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (stands for Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk. You responsibilities will be to collect, check, and provide data from our business to our internal clients (Finance, Actuary ‚Ä¶) using automated tools.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE FAR DATA TEAM

  • Participate in data quality audit work on a defined scope:
  • Participate in the administration of the necessary repositories on its perimeter
  • Participate in the development of the reference documentation associated with the data
  • Participate in the governance of data quality

As Our New Accounting Data Analyst, You Must Have

  • Degree in Data Analysis, Finance or Actuarial
  • Professional background about 3/5 years in data analysis for finance/accounting functions.
  • Fluent in English (C1 level is mandatory)
  • Fluency in French (B1-B2 level would be greatly appreciated, but not mandatory)
  • Strong Excel VBA skills
  • Professional experience with SAS
  • Experience or academic knowledge of the actuarial sector would be a big plus

What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :

  • Meals allowance
  • Transportation allowance
  • Child allowance
  • Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
  • Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
  • Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
  • And much more‚Ä¶

The work environment is important!

  • Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
  • Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
  • Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.

Our commitments to you

  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Master Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
FARO is an imaging company - and an‚ÄØimagining company.‚ÄØWe envision a better, more insightful, and more powerful world realized through digital 3D means and measurement technologies.‚ÄØRight from the start, we have helped our customers make better decisions - faster and more accurately than anyone else in the industry. ‚ÄØ

We work with the largest companies on the planet to provide the solutions that enable them to overcome their most pressing industry challenges. In aerospace and automotive, we work with firms like SpaceX, NASA, Tesla and Volvo among others. In the construction industry, we work with the largest builders to scan and design astonishing projects. For public safety professionals, our forensics scanning tools solve crimes and document scenes with high tech gear you probably see on CSI and in the movies!‚ÄØ

Learn more about FARO here

We believe that if it can be dreamed it can also be measured.‚ÄØAnd if it can be measured, it can also be realized.

We are seeking a Master Data Analyst (m/w/d), located in Portugal, in Porto.

How you will make a difference @ FARO


Develop and maintain the Enterprise Data Model and ensure its alignment with business goals and objectives
Develop data models that align with enterprise data management practices and business objectives; mentor junior team members
Design complex data models for reporting and analytics that align with business and regulatory requirements and optimize performance
Develop detailed metadata for regulatory submissions, analyze and resolve data quality issues
Lead the identification and resolution of data issues within the organization, and mentor junior team members
Lead the identification and resolution of data issues within the organization
Lead projects to create record of reference systems for key enterprise data
Lead efforts to define business data requirements and develop standard enterprise data policies, standards, procedures, and metadata naming conventions, while mentoring junior team members


This position requires


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as computer science, information systems, or data management or equivalent experience
Demonstrated complete and full knowledge and experience of data modeling concepts, methodologies, and tools
Proven experience in designing complex data models for reporting and analytics
Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and data quality management
Experience in leading data analysis and issue resolution
Excellent documentation and organization skills
Ability to mentor and guide junior team members
Strong communication and collaboration skills


FARO offers


In general, a permanent employment contract
Meal Allowance: Enjoy a generous meal allowance of 8.32‚Ç¨ per day, helping you savour a variety of delicious options during your breaks.
Comprehensive Health Insurance: We provide extensive health insurance coverage for you and your spouse, ensuring peace of mind for your family.
Generous Vacation Policy: With 22 days of paid vacation, you'll have plenty of time to relax and recharge.
Flexible Working Hours: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working hours to suit your schedule.
Office Perks: Our office is stocked with free drinks and fresh fruit, keeping you refreshed and energized throughout the day.
Prime Location: Our office boasts a stunning terrace with panoramic views of the city and river. You'll be just steps away from a vibrant selection of shops and restaurants, perfect for your lunch breaks or after-work activities.
On-site Coffee Shop: Take advantage of our cozy coffee shop located on the 5th floor, ideal for quick breaks or casual meetings.


Inclusive

At FARO, we are committed to encouraging different perspectives and ideas that foster innovation.‚ÄØ We believe that we are strongest with a diverse team of employees.‚ÄØ We want every FARO employee to feel our commitment to showing respect for all and encouraging open collaboration and communication.

Join us. Become part of a dynamic organization that values quality, leadership, teamwork, honesty and openness as a way of life in conducting our business. ‚ÄØ

Title: Data & AI Security Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and passionate Data & AI Security Professional to join our team. As a Data & AI Security Professional, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative Data & AI-driven solutions to address complex business challenges. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to collect, analyze, and interpret data to drive actionable insights and enhance decision-making processes.

Responsibilities



You provide technical leadership as we design and deploy secure Data&AI architectures for on premises and cloud solutions.


Leading workshops on the key Data & AI security challenges of our clients.


Experience in preparing system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends for project and operational and project governance reporting.


Strong analytical skills to solve technical issues and flexibility in handling multiple issues at once.


Partnering with our clients to find the best Data & AI security solutions.


Driven cyber security professional with a passion for information security.



Qualifications



A Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferably related to Business IT or Security, such as Business Informatics, Computer Security, Data Science or equivalent.


Basic understanding of Cybersecurity and at least one of the fundamental areas of Data Security: Discovery and Classification or Data Encryption.


Knowledge in programming languages such as Python, R, Scala or related.


Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistics.


Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills in addition to strong attention to detail.


Strong collaboration skills, ideally working with global and multi-functional teams.


Fluent in English.


Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.



Preferred Qualifications



Cloud Security (Azure AZ-900, AZ-500 and AWS Security an advantage)


Data Security related vendor certification(s). (Microsoft, Thales, SailPoint)


Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: mid level

Type of position: hybrid

The amazing you, will have:




3+years experience working with data;
Proficiency in SQL (Crud, data models, transactionality, tuning);
Knowledge about multidimensional modeling concepts;
Strong data analysis skills;
TDD\BDD knowledge;
Knowledge of Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration, Delivery, and Deployment through CI Pipelines;
Good English level.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Good French level




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!

Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.


Job Description


We are looking for a Data Engineer with experience in Python and ETL processes to deliver high quality data tools and support the business.


Qualifications


  • 4 years of experience;
  • Develop and design data pipelines/ETL in Python;
  • Industrialize processes for full automation;
  • Build and design visualization tools (e.g dashboards) with Powerbi;
  • Experience with PySpark ;
  • Experience with SQL;
  • English - fluent.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us




We love data.

Envisioning advanced data architectures and bringing them to live is our passion.

reeeliance is a consultancy specializing in Data Management, Fast Data, Advanced Analytics, and DataOps. We further support our clients in modernizing their SAP landscape and moving their business to the cloud.




Based in Hamburg, Berlin, and Porto, we combine strategic foresight with sound data and software engineering craftsmanship to define, build, and operate scalable information ecosystems for our international clients, helping them transform into real data-driven enterprises.




About the role




Data is undeniably one of the world's most valuable resources. However, it's futile if it's not in the right place or the right setup. We strive to place data where it's needed most and can be used to its fullest potential.




Become a valued member of our data integration team and build with us highly scalable data architectures and fast data pipelines for our multinational clients. Our use cases range from data warehouse and lakehouse architectures implementations over IoT and data streaming setups to sophisticated AI scenarios, in industries ranging from manufacturing, consumer products, healthcare to banking and insurance, just to name a few.




Our Tech Stack at a glance

Coding: SQL, Python | Data Pipeline: Matillion, VaultSpeed | Data Storage: Snowflake, Azure Synapse | DevOps: Azure DevOps, GitLab




Your responsibilities:




In this role you have the chance to design, build and maintain data pipelines according to the client's business needs and embed them end-to-end into the given data stack
As a Data Engineer you will maintain and optimize the data infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources
You build, maintain, and deploy data artifacts on cloud platforms
You will ensure of data accuracy, integrity, privacy, security, and compliance by applying data quality assurances methods
Your responsibility will include monitoring of data pipeline performance as well as the implementation of optimization strategies
You will work together with both reeeliance and client staff as part of an agile team




Our requirements:




Proficiency in both classic and recent data modeling concepts
Applicable knowledge in data warehousing architectures and best practice design
Experience and confidence in using at least one ETL tool and proficiency in Python
Ability to read and understand complex data flows paired with strong SQL skills
Hands on experience in orchestrating data pipelines within cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
Problem-solving attitude
Independent working style
Experience with working as part of a team in agile project setups
A university degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline
Articulate with impeccable verbal and written communication skills in English. Strong & discerning listener. Another language skill is a plus




What we offer:




Responsible roles in international projects
Space to grow and to take over responsibility
Dedicated onboarding program
Work with the cutting-edge technology
A permanent employment in a family-friendly company,
Working in a multinational team (more than 15 nationalities)
Flexible working hours
Participation in regular team events in Berlin and Hamburg
Further training opportunities
Modern equipment
Classes of German language
And many other Job perks (childcare subsidy, company pension scheme, job bike, etc‚Ä¶)




We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team.




JOIN US ‚Äì and grab your opportunity!




Please have in mind only short-listed candidates will be contacted.




For any questions, please write to marija.sekularac@reeeliance.com or send a DM.

HTML:
About us


We love data.

Envisioning advanced data architectures and bringing them to live is our passion.

reeeliance is a consultancy specializing in Data Management, Fast Data, Advanced Analytics, and DataOps. We further support our clients in modernizing their SAP landscape and moving their business to the cloud.


Based in Hamburg, Berlin, and Porto, we combine strategic foresight with sound data and software engineering craftsmanship to define, build, and operate scalable information ecosystems for our international clients, helping them transform into real data-driven enterprises.


About the role


Data is undeniably one of the world's most valuable resources. However, it's futile if it's not in the right place or the right setup. We strive to place data where it's needed most and can be used to its fullest potential.


Become a valued member of our data integration team and build with us highly scalable data architectures and fast data pipelines for our multinational clients. Our use cases range from data warehouse and lakehouse architectures implementations over IoT and data streaming setups to sophisticated AI scenarios, in industries ranging from manufacturing, consumer products, healthcare to banking and insurance, just to name a few.


Our Tech Stack at a glance

Coding: SQL, Python | Data Pipeline: Matillion, VaultSpeed | Data Storage: Snowflake, Azure Synapse | DevOps: Azure DevOps, GitLab


Your responsibilities:


  • In this role you have the chance to design, build and maintain data pipelines according to the client's business needs and embed them end-to-end into the given data stack
  • As a Data Engineer you will maintain and optimize the data infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources
  • You build, maintain, and deploy data artifacts on cloud platforms
  • You will ensure of data accuracy, integrity, privacy, security, and compliance by applying data quality assurances methods
  • Your responsibility will include monitoring of data pipeline performance as well as the implementation of optimization strategies
  • You will work together with both reeeliance and client staff as part of an agile team


Our requirements:


  • Proficiency in both classic and recent data modeling concepts
  • Applicable knowledge in data warehousing architectures and best practice design
  • Experience and confidence in using at least one ETL tool and proficiency in Python
  • Ability to read and understand complex data flows paired with strong SQL skills
  • Hands on experience in orchestrating data pipelines within cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
  • Problem-solving attitude
  • Independent working style
  • Experience with working as part of a team in agile project setups
  • A university degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline
  • Articulate with impeccable verbal and written communication skills in English. Strong & discerning listener. Another language skill is a plus


What we offer:


  • Responsible roles in international projects
  • Space to grow and to take over responsibility
  • Dedicated onboarding program
  • Work with the cutting-edge technology
  • A permanent employment in a family-friendly company,
  • Working in a multinational team (more than 15 nationalities)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Participation in regular team events in Berlin and Hamburg
  • Further training opportunities
  • Modern equipment
  • Classes of German language
  • And many other Job perks (childcare subsidy, company pension scheme, job bike, etc‚Ä¶)


We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team.


JOIN US ‚Äì and grab your opportunity!


Please have in mind only short-listed candidates will be contacted.


For any questions, please write to marija.sekularac@reeeliance.com or send a DM.

Title: Data Visualization Engineer
HTML:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:

  • Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects;
  • Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access;
  • Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes;
  • Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.


What are we looking for?

  • BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
  • Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar;
  • Proficiency in data prep tools or components such as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
  • Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
  • Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
  • Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.


Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're Hiring: Data Engineer (2-4 years of experience)

We're looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our team! If you have a passion for working with data and enjoy building scalable data pipelines, this role is for you.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, test, and maintain robust data pipelines using Python, Apache Spark, and Databricks.
Work with large datasets in Hadoop environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data solutions that meet business needs.
Optimize and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure performance and reliability.
Ensure best practices for data management, security, and governance.




Requirements:

2 to 4 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Hands-on experience with Apache Spark and Hadoop.
Experience with Databricks or other cloud-based data platforms.
Knowledge of ETL processes and data integration.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work on exciting data projects in a collaborative and dynamic environment.
Professional growth and development opportunities.




How to Apply: If you‚Äôre passionate about data and want to work with cutting-edge technologies, apply now! Send your resume and a brief cover letter to hr@datacentric-tech.com or through the LinkedIn application process.

¬†

Join us & Become part of DataCentric Team!

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work¬©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.


Job Description


  • Providing first level support for Loan IQ users on an IT point of view;
  • Gathering requirements and creating functional specifications for enhancements and/or bug fixes;
  • Testing developed functionalities;
  • Participation in projects in the scope of the stream;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior members of the team on best practices for projects and general tasks of an IT Business Analyst.

Qualifications

  • Have previous experience working as an IT Business Analyst (on the IT side), minimum 4 years
  • Agile framework experience needed;
  • SQL knowledge needed;
  • Have a good level of English ‚Äì B2 minimum;
  • Be proactive and capable to work in autonomy;
  • Loan IQ knowledge (nice to have)

Title: PL/SQL Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: PL/SQL

Seniority: mid level

Type of position: hybrid

The amazing you, will have:




High degree in Computer Science (or equivalent);
3-5 years as PLSQL Developer;
Oracle Database;
UNIX/LINUX;
Shell Scripting;
Experience with Version Control (Git)




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):




Develop/Maintain Control-M chain;
DevOps tools: Jenkins, XL Deploy, XL Release;
Experience with JIRA




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!

Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
